name: Chia
desc:
Statistics

    * Altitude 1800 metres (5850 feet) ASL
    * Top to bottom height: 400 metres (1300 feet)
    * Orientations S and SE

Access

From the south side of the Chia pass there is a dirt track which leads to both launches.

South East launch: This is in the bowl facing ESE. Parking near the water container, you walk 80 m up the hill were there is a large grassy launch, suitable for easy top landings.

Southerly launch: follow the track out of the bowl to the main southerly face. Take off is a very shallow grassy area which is safe and easy for top landing. This site can take a lot of southerly wind witha degree of safety (slightly rising grazing land behind reduce rotor effects.
Often the base can be low and raining in the Piedrahita valley, and flyable in Chia.  It is a place you can often fly when on a day which starts to overdevelop, since Cbs generally form at other points around it.  However, you still need to go and land when they get big as they can break into the Chia valley

name: La Lastra del Cano
desc:
Statistics

    * Altitude: 1.625 metres (5281 feet) ASL
    * Top to Bottom height: 500 metres (1625 feet)
    * Orientation : S and W On any good day with light winds the wind will also come on at PeÃ±a Negra (Piedrahita),  If it is a south windday the anabatic wind can get very strong early on.

name: Jabalcon (Zujar)
desc:
The NW takeoff is very large and located at the very top of the hill.  No serious hazards apart from the masts behind.  Ridge to the right of takeoff is apparently a good thermal trigger.

The Southerly takeoff is has been manicured for paragliding but does require very committed launch.  People tended to head straight to the huge rock face to the right of takeoff.  

Never flown easterly, very intimidating launch.  Only enough room for one glider and maybe four or five steps. Sometimes rough convergences can develop later in the day.

name: Las Mallolas
desc: Pretty straightforward, but reverse launching mandatory. Beware of the small bushes when preinflating your wing. You have to fly with wind from S or SW. Wind can be too strong to fly.

name: Alcaudete
desc:
We have launch sites within a radius of three miles for all orientations, so that if no strong wind or rain, we have secured a flight every day. Below I put a brief description of the takeoff and landing areas, with pictures of each.
----------------------------------
SIERRA AHILLOS see photos (4)
Coordinates:
latitude = 37.5996750
length = -4.0307188
Altitude 1373 m.

SIERRA Ahillos to Alcaudete
The mountain of Alcaudete Ahillos to (have to walk twenty minutes) has a vertical drop of 720m facing both North and South, when on southern weather to more than 25 km / h is to get to the landing and you'll almost all the while the wind in your face. The flight north is usually very soft, with too much height at the landings as well be you take some heat from those usually formed more by the way you can make a very entertaining flight. Alcaudete landing on whether it goes to North as the South side of the park just before the football pitch with a huge landing for anyone, about 400m long and 200m wide just outside the village. Takeoff is not suitable for beginners.
--------------------------
SIERRA CARACOLERA view photos (3)
Coordinates:
latitude = 37.6209310
length = -4.0129548
Altitude: 1270 m.

SIERRA CARACOLERA TO LAS CASILLAS TOWN
For the launch of the Sierra Caracolera orientation is north marsh landing on the football field of the box or on the shore of the reservoir in case anyone does not have enough precision to land on the soccer field, the edge of swamp is very large, well enough to land with delta wings, with a drop of about 650m and a landing distance of 500m. There is also a takeoff on the E face SE to surround the mountain gives Caracolera and more than enough to reach the landing of the boxes, but to reach this you have to walk about ten minutes. They are famous here and winter flights at north and allow us to hours of flight by side with conditions very similar to a beach (very clean wind goes toward the hillside, having no natural obstacles in front). Access to off-road drive north, we should not go off easier and cleaner to inflate the front. Landing very spacious and clean perfect for novice riders.
----------------------------
CERRO GARCIA view photos (4)
Coordinates:
latitude = 37.6130496
length = -4.0129179
Altitude: 1195 m.

FROM CERRO DE GARCÃA TO CORTIJO PORTILLO OR LAS CASILLAS TOWN
In that area a departure from West and West Southwest on a hill (Cerro Garcia) between the Caracolera and Ahillos and landing on a field free of obstructions with a height of 250 m off the road rise to takeoff Portillo's farmhouse, so it can be done in several flights lazy days and more days of wind can slope. Takeoff with east behind the west to the swamp for lazy days, you reach the dam 200 meters high. Access to tourism drive off, away from the car to take off 50m. Peel school very easy, much clearance. Landing School also very clean and spacious, as seen in the photo above, perfect for novice riders.
-----------------------------
MORRON see photos (3)
Coordinates:
latitude = 37.5914660
length = -4.0502012
Altitude: 1086 m.

MORRON TO ALCAUDETE
The MorrÃ³n with a drop of 400 meters from the landing to reach the park of Alcaudete (same landing from Ahillos). It has all the directions from north to south west and west to take off and easy access, which may be the most used, as it would make several flights in a short time. Just bring it we need a little cleaning up the stones in the north and south off the west and is clean. For now, take off West clean, north and southwest departures hard (only reverse inflation and slightly margin of motion).

The best conditions are gentle breeze 10 to 20 km / h. and NE wind.  The wing inflates smoothly and we have room for a check. With more wind on takeoff take care, because being a rocky cliff itb is difficult to abort.

Flying to West you have 15 km to Mazagon town to fly over the shoreline if the wind have 15 to 30 km/h from SW. All shoreline from MatalascaÃ±as to Mazagon is protected for wildlife.

desc:
This is one of the only two legally permitted TO-sites in the 'Teide'-National Park!
This site is normally flown (very) early in the morning; later the cloud cover can close completely and/ or the east wind will not permit TO anymore. If the wind is coming from the EAST (landside) in Puerto de la Cruz, do NOT set up your approach over the water, ALWAYS remain over land! (you'd not be the first pilot to drown in the sea, because he could not reach land anymore...)

Le décollage est favorable de NE, E, SE à S.
C’est défavorable s’il est orienté de SO, O, NO à N.
Suivant la force des vents SO, O à N, il est tout à fait possible de décoller des Deux potes mais attention aux turbulences. Une flammèche est visible sur la webcam du téléphérique. C’est un très bon indicateur de l’orientation du vent au décollage.

name: Moustiers Ste.Marie - Mt.Denier
desc:
huge, easy

Other TO 'Courchon' at N43.84278, E6.23028, 905m available: rather flat, stony: not so easy in low winds Breeze coming from the lake (west) and could be strong in summer.
In summer between 1300-1700 it can get very strong/ bumpy - beware of eventual dust devils at LZ.
Wind info for Moustiers (also on FFVL frequency):
http://www.balisemeteo.com/depart.php?dept=04
http://www.balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=130

name: Saint Vincent les Forts
desc:
At the village entry, very short but good breeze blowing here : not recommended to novices. Lake breeze may get strong at take off during the hot afternoon hours.
Avoyd the rotors while landing top : don't go to far downwind on your landing approach.
This site can be flown if there is 'Mistral' in the Rhone valley, but then it gets )very) crowded...

name: Les Richards
desc:
Alti: 1550m
you can see it from the valley, on the top of a little hill with a pretty little village: 'Les Richards'.
Grass, large take off.
From the landing area take the road to the mountain, cross the little village (pass a farm) and park your car near the take off. Don't forgot to close the enclosure in your back. With strong valley wind landing could be difficult.

name: Orcieres
desc:
in the mountain, north west of the ski runs starting : a bad(!) track is going there (4x4), or 20 minutes walk.
Altn TO: at 'les Marches (2WD + 10mins hike):
N44 41 40.9 E6 18 10.6, 1940m Strong conditions may be found at the landing.
This site can be flown if there is 'Mistral' in the Rhone Valley

name: Puy Aillaud
desc:
In 'Vallouise' take to the right on the front of the church a little road to 'Puy Aillaud'.
the first way start 300m before the village, on your left (walk 10mn).
the second way start above the village, 'La Blanche' direction (by walk too...). You can fly here if it's north wind, but be careful: the protection isn't unlimited...

name: Laragne - le Chabre
desc:
N and S TO at end of paved road (HG/ PG);
or continue on dirt road to top:
ramp for S TO, fields for S and N TO (HG/ PG) During afternoon in summer wind might be too strong at take-off.

Mistral can stop flying if sufficiently strong. 

Summer: with N-/ NW- wind (after approx 1300) very rough, turbulent thermals can be triggered off the rocky slopes below, which can make TO dangerous  > be airborne before!

name: Aspres
desc: During summer/ midday thermals can be VERY activ/ rough -definitively NOT for beginners!!

name: Sospel - Agaisen
desc: The Agaisen launch, which faces SW, is perfect for going XC from. The locals call it \'The Lift\', for its large, regular thermals, and people have flown to Saint-Andre from here (appx 75km).

name: Gourdon
desc:
L'embarnier - a SE-facing rugged ridge, actually two takeoffs, a small one right next to the parking with a big rock in its midst, another one, large and easy, reachable by a short walk up the ridge. Although SE-facing, this site is protected by the sea breeze and is generally flyable even with a moderate NW,N or NE meteo wind above. 

The site can be turbulent in a strong northerly meteo wind. Southerly wind reinforces the sea breeze.

In spring/summer, conditions usually get quite strong at midday, but that is lunch time anyway.

name: Cagnorina - Tende- Tenda
desc:
From Tende, take the road for La Pia, and follow the 'Parapente' signs to take-off. (This is about a 15 minute drive). You will pass a stadium on the way up, which can be used as a landing area in early mornings or evenings, but becomes too turbulent for use during the day. 

Col de Tende: Turn immediately left after the Tende tunnel on the N204. Cross the '3 Amis' station, and climb up to the col on a good road (30 minutes from Tende).

name: Monaco- Roquebrune- Mont Gros
desc:
Leave the A8 at La Turbie, and follow the signs for the Monte Carlo golf club. Turn right at the Monte-Carlo radio antennae. Parking is limited (10 places) and hitching back up for a vehicle difficult. It makes sense to use the navette (euro1), which leaves from the car park opposite the train station (close to the landing area) between 10am and 4pm (10am, 11.15, 14.00 15.15 - only Oct-April). BEWARE OF FLYING RESTRICTIONS ( NOTAM, ZIT MENTON) ALWAYS CHECK Roquebrunailes website or fb BEFORE TAKING OFF. 

If you see white waves on the see, just don't take off or if you are already flying, go to the landing quick. The beach landing can be turbulent in an easterly wind. Do not launch if there are 'white horses' on the sea - it is too windy!
Detailed wx info here: http://www.roquebrunailes.com/en/local-aerology-roquebrune.htm
Wx forcast here: http://www.roquebrunailes.com/en/weather-forecast-roquebrune.htm

LIVE WIND SENSOR: http://www.balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=163

name: Greolieres
desc:
The main (lower) take-off is a 30 min walk from GrÃ©oliÃ¨res village. The school runs a navette service (from 9 am) to this or to the upper TO in summer. Ski station chair lifts from the resort of GrÃ©oliÃ¨res-les-Neiges can be used to access this upper take-off in winter. 

300, main launch
30 minute walk from the schoollanding field, or use the Navette service from here. 

600 and 700
1 hour's walk from Greolieres-les-Neiges or Navette from the school landing field. 4x4 access in private vehicles is not allowed. 

1000 Cheiron summit 
1h20 walk from the school landing field. Chairlifts from the ski station at Greolieres-les-Neiges can be used in winter. 

Navette Prices
Le Dahut (lower takeoff) 5 Euros or Â½ ticket 
700 or Jerusalem (upper) 8 Euros or 1 ticket. 
10 tickets = 60 Euros Valley winds at the landing field are usually from the east. If there is a westerly blowing, the site gets very turbulent and it is not advisable to fly.

name: Thorenc - Col de Bleyne
desc:
alti:1525m
Approximately 400m top to bottom. 

Beware of snagging lines on stones / shrubs on take-off. The wind can switch direction slightly, making launching a little tricky if you catch it at the wrong moment. It can be turbulent in a westerly - better to decamp to Lachens.

name: Auron
desc:
alti: 2274m
The summit of Cime de la Bercha can be gained via a cable car from St Etienne de TinÃ©e, or by a rough track from Auron. 

Las Donnas is reachable by a cable car from Auron. It is on the south side of Auron, so in the mornings when you can launch facing N or E you can land in the Auron valley, but once it becomes thermic you\'ll be on the south side of the mountain. It is easy to land in the small village of Roya, which is served by a road (the D61), but advisable to arrange a retrieve before doing so! 

The cable cars work all winter, and also in July and August.

name: Déco Baisse de Raymond (Veillos)
desc:
There are several take-offs at La Colmiane, but the most often used are the two described below: 

Veillos 
There are actually two south-facing 'Veillos' launches, that are located on spines of the Mont PÃ©toumier - Mont PÃ©poiri ridge north of La Colmiane. All summer there is a Navette from the Veillos chairlift, and the chairlift itself is in use.You can also drive up: 

From La Colmiane, head out on the D2565 towards St Dalmas. On the very first sharp left-hand U-bend in the road, there is a minor road that goes straight. Take this. It immediately splits into two forks, the right-hand one of which is the track up to take-off. (There is a chain across the bottom - replace this after you). You pass 2 hang-glider launches as you zig-zag up the hillside, and the road eventually flattens out and goes into the back of the bowl. Continue here, going left on the main track when the road goes right to a refuge. The road follows the ridge-line to its end, and then zig-zags up again. You can park at the top of the zig-zags. Take-off is the grassy area above the road. 

Le Pic de Colmiane 
From the col at la Colmiane, drive up the dirt track that goes to Col du Suc, which is signed 'Parapente'. Drive past the first streamered area - the better takeoff is higher up. You can park in the obvious area where the road goes over the col, and walk up the footpath which goes to the top of the chairlift. Launch is just below the chairlift, and is a clear, grassy area marked by windsocks. Beware that wind can easily switch from coming up to coming over the back of the col above the main landing therefore you should check the wind direction on approach. The valley is also pretty well protected but the surrounding valeys are narrow, this should be taken into account if leaving the area and flying XC

Very nice. 
Just a 1 minute walk from the road at the Col de Meyrand.
Top landing possible.

name: Clamontard - Luc-en-Diois
desc:
North -also good with NW and NE.
Often there is a West component, so the TO is in the lee: watch the different windspies very closely, turn immediately left after launching.

To get there: 7 KM to TO:
From Luc-en-Diois follow direction Gap (south);
after the big rocks and the Drome river bridge, turn right (signs: 'site d'envol').
After 2 Km you will see a sign and an unpaved road on your left, follow it till the end. West wind make launch (take off) hazardous

Wind info (also on FFVL frequency):
- http://balisemeteo.com/depart.php?dept=26
- http://balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=33

name: Lesches en diois
desc:
south faced, high in altitude, south of france, dont be late, thermals are strong after 11 am in summer. 

from luc en diois, folow gap direction, after 2 Km , you will find a special cross, turn right to go left at lesches en diois.
6 Km after, pass the nice village.
800m after, leave the tarmac and turn left,(sign : site de vol libre)
150 m landing on the right, continue 4 km till the end off the road. walk 200m easy (flat walk) and you will be on the take off (huge, suitable for 10 wings) dangerous when the drome valley brise is arriving from the north, your on lee side!!!

name: Die
desc:
in die, go to the south (gap direction)
turn right to ausson road, pass the river, and 80m after turn rigth when you see the sign : croix de justin
7 Km of road without tarmac but very good.
take off just before the big steel cross ( near antennas) on the left side. wind
don't fly if there is wind
just if it is brise or thermals.
always watch the wind at the top near antennas.

name: Aurel
desc: Careful with nort-east winds (> lee!)

Col du Trallu - Col des Limouches TO and LZ: with Nord-Est wind in the lee!

name: Barneville sur seine
desc:
There are two starting directions: 
30Â° has a nice, long, shallow and well maintained meadow but (!) this meadow is surrounded by high trees. the only obvious way out is a tiny gap at the bottom at ~35Â°.
330Â° has no slope at all. a flat top of great meadow grass abruptly turns into a cliff full of nettles. Due to the form of the neighboring slopes all NW winds are channeled up that cliff.

name: Menez-Hom (Menez Hom)
desc:
alti: 330m (2nd highest mountain in Brittany)
easy takeoff, better if you know playing with the wind. weather on www.vol-libre-menez-hom.com/html/iframes/meteo.htm

desc: Property of FFVL meteo on www.celtic-vol-libre.fr

name: Mont Bouquet
desc:
North, a bit... experimental, we work on it
North-east crosswind, cliff takeoff (only for good pilots) East, flyable from NE to SE (La Vierge) South, flyable from SE to SO (2 takeoffs) (La VerriÃ¨re & Le Relais) In the summer, beware of frequent storms.

name: Anduze
desc: need to be cleaned... a lot of bushes...

name: Pompignan
desc: There are 2 small takeoff : one paragliding, the other for hanggliding Be carefull : the W-NW wind can rise suddenly and be strong so listen the 'Seranne' transmitter on 143.987.5 Mhz on the radio giving goods informations

name: Superbagneres - luchon
desc:
Drive to the ski sation, outside the times that the ski lift doesn't run. Otherwise, take the lift, take off is immediately on the left on the slope next to the derelict church. Steep, but easy. Wind will be light so forward is needed sometimes. Southwind is dangerous. Lots of turbulence. Strong valley wind in the afternoon. 
Fly Lac d'Oo instead and come back evening for a nice valley wind soar.

name: Arbas
desc:
Never fly with west wind !

Flyable in case of south wind (protected) but only for experimented pilots.

name: Dausse
desc: Beware trees just under take-off. Turbulent flying with west wind.

name: Gensac
desc: strong West wind =  turbulence

name: Saint clar
desc: This is a winch site.

name: La Seranne - Déco France
desc:
Décollage pour le parapente et un pour le deltaplane. Vent : S et SE/SO
Ne pas se jeter dans la sellette. Bien penser à courrir courrir et encore courrir.
S'attendre a un thermique en sortie de déco. Et donc faire une tempo / coup de frein.  Tenir sa voile. You can fly with N and NW wind but it can be strong suddenly so be careful. Tune your radio to the frequency 143.98.75 to hear the updated wind information broadcast every 10 minutes

name: CLARET
desc: Takeoff : the bigger is S-SE and the is a little when wind is S-SW Be carefull : wind from W - NW can rise suddenly and can be strong : listen the 'Seranne' transmitter on 143.987.5Mhz on your radio giving goods informations

name: Connex
desc: on the top of the hill. It\'s in the middle of grenoble\'s valley.

name: Jas d'oris
desc:
grass mountain shield.
From "Oris en ratier" take a track which goes in mountain, "Jas d'Oris", direction (Coirot summit). Stop in the last turn, before the shepherd house. strong mountain conditions.

name: Chalais
desc:
20 mn by feet from Chalais,
5 km east of Voreppe,
15 km NW from Grenoble.

Easy take off!

Landing not visible from take off.
Take care about thermal wind in valley : morning site ! Thermal wind in valley comes quickly with sun : fly there in the morning.

desc:
Dangerous in strong south wind!
Weather: http://www.villarddelans.com/weather_ski_resort_mountain_vercors_station_ski_alps_isere_ski_france-meteo-1769-ETE-UK-vercors.html

Good place for waggas. :-D be carful about strong north wind. You are under the wind (vet montain).

name: Saint Pierre de Chartreuse - La Scia
desc:
Two available : West & South
West take off should be avoided when ski resort is open.
Accessible by road then path, or cable car during winter and july-august.
No difficulty, large take off. Take care with south wind that generally become strong in the afternoon.
Take off with north wind sometimes a bit hazardous.

name: Allevard-Malatrait
desc:
short takeoff. Little valley on your left very dangerous with north wind. On your front and right it's all good!
alti: 1450m in the end of the day very good and mystic restitution on the middle valley. Landing with the night, take your light ;-)
Only when it's north wind and sunny during the day.

name: Allevard-St Pierre
desc:
coming from the south (grenoble), take on the left when you enter in "St Pierre d'Allevard" village, direction "la Chapelle St Christophe". Walk 5 minuts.
alti: 1000m you are under the wind when it\'s north or NW wind.

name: Courtet
desc:
alti 1380m
From landing site, road to Treminis while 300m then trek until the end. Speed limitation 15 km/h, no 4x4 required in Grenoble district, it's the best site when it's strong north wind, with Montlambert.
Dangerous when South, left side of take off in whirlings.

name: Chamrousse - l'Aiguille / la Croix
desc:
> l'Aiguille: alti: 1840m; on a little hill, just above 'Recoin' village.
> 'la Sapiniere' lies a little lower/ to the NW and is used if 'Aiguille' is in clouds.
> la Croix: alti: 2250m; near the cable car, on the sky station summit. good grass shield.
3 take off, 2 landings, 600 m to 1800 m flying . be careful of strong wind, especially NE and SW.
http://www.balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=144

name: Le Grand Ratz
desc:
20 mn by foot from parking at Le Grand Ratz village,
over La Placette pass,
near Pommiers La Placette,
north of Voreppe,
15 km NW of Grenoble

Afternoon and evening take off.

Caution with south wind, not detectable at take off ... South wind may be undetectable at take off, and become very strong at landing. You will also fly in dangerous conditions (downwind rotors)

name: Montaud
desc:
On the road from Montaud to Autrans, before Mortier tunel (road really closed : take off not accessible from Autrans).
Montaud village is 5 km south from Voreppe -via Veurey- 15 km NW from Grenoble.
Take off is on road side ... no walking !
Impressive for beginners : good slope, not too wide, but no real danger if breeze is present. While take off is NW oriented, fly there by N or even NE. Take care at NW and avoid W :
dangers come from wind along the cliffs, W oriented.

grass.
take the ski-lift 'Le Diable', take off on your right when you arrive. strong wind with high mountain is not a good idee to fly.

windsock present.

name: Douelle
desc: Take off is a wide grassy area, in the middle of the bowl.There is enough room to topland. A windsock and a local weather are present. Turbulent with west wind.

name: Dreuilh
desc: Overhanging take off, stony and no trees.

name: Penne d\'agenais
desc:
Park in front of the entrance to the village and walk the last 100m. It is normally not allowed to drive to the top, but i imagine being dropped off there is not a problem.
The take-off has recently (7/4/2008) been cleaned up from last year. There is a windsock and a big dirt point which would be launchable for those whom wish to walk up with their glider over head. Alternatively, take off next to the hump.

name: Laparade
desc: Two possible launches, both require lift and excellent control.

name: Nicole
desc: The north-east launch is a nice flat grassy space with a steep cliff. The south-west launch is  a little tricky, carefully circumvent the benches, on the other side of the cross. Toplanding is easy and recommended.

name: Ispagnac
desc:
Dangerous in windy conditions
dangereux par vent mÃƒÂ©tÃƒÂ©o

name: Le villard
desc: Indications on the take off.

name: Coutures
desc: Chemin agricole, dÃ©part au treuil. RAS

name: Saint mathurin
desc: Chemin agricole, dÃ©part en treuillÃ©.

name: Chemellier
desc: Chemin agricole. DÃ©part en treuil. Orientation nord-nord-est/sud-sud-ouest. RAS

name: Sion - vaudemont
desc: Barres Monument.

name: Haselbourg-neustadtmuhle
desc:
Turn right to enter the village, park you car on the small parking on your right (near a restaurant). Walk 100 meters, the take off is on your right (folow a small path next to a pink house). If you arrive to the cemetery, you\'ve been walking too far !
The landing zone is on the right (not visible).

The take off located in Hommert (N-NE) is in front of you.

name: Donon
desc:
845 meters.

Large and easy. 5 minutes walk from the parking. Speed and direction of wind in the valley changing quite quickly.
Ensure first you can get to the landing zone : impossible to land anywhere else apart on small paths down the take-off (very tricky).

name: Hommert
desc:
From Saverne, cross the village.
Almost at the end, turn left on

name: Haute-kontz
desc:
In the middle of the village, continue on the road which leads to the take off (small path).

Small take-off.

Difficult for beginners. Possible strong thermals.

name: Auteuil
desc:
dÃ©co trÃ¨s large, preferer le milieu de la pente pour voler en dynamique au niveau de la cassure.
Ne pas se mettre trop loin derriere (turbulences)

name: Dannes
desc: Site de départ cross. Peu adapté au soaring

name: Frencq
desc: FFVL sign marks access to take off field (grass).  Beware of not damaging the fencing when climbing over it to get to the take off.  The flying area is quite small and suitable for no more than 4 paragliders

name: Mieures - campagne les boulonnais
desc: Treuil..

all orientations. Wind info: http://www.balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=46
Webcam: http://wwwobs.univ-bpclermont.fr/opgc/webcam.php

desc:

take off on the grass!
good start for Xcountry. good informations: http://www.balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=30

name: Puy de l\'angle et du mareuilh
Accous - 500
desc: for wx call: 05 59 34 59 39

name: Accous - delta-parapente
desc: for wx call: 05 59 34 59 39

name: Mail d'Eygarry
desc: Dangers : risk of rotor and/or foehn with south wind. strong valley wind possible in the afternoon.

name: Vallee du louron
desc:
East : easy
South : delicate - need to fly above the saddle to come back on Louron side
Northeast : very gentle slope

Different TO sites available > see FFVL-page! South Wind can be very dangerous !
In summer time, contact local pilots when wheather looks good but no paragliders are in the sky

name: Col du Couraduque
desc: NOT recommeded in SOUTH winds

name: Hautacam -la Bergerie
desc: ATTN: respect private land! do not cross private land (> picture)/ stay on track to TO! Dangerous with SOUTH wind!

name: Bareges-tourmalet
desc: TOP landing possible

name: Pla d'Adet
desc:
Le Pla d'Adet
Orientation: The North-East
Altitude: 1600 m

Access: Cable car of St Lary (Winter and summer) or by the road which leads to the station.

Flying conditions: Favorable conditions by breeze of slope, in dynamics and by wind of north.

Dangers and difficulties: Cables of the cable car and EDF lines. Wind of very dangerous south.

Le Plat d'Adet
Orientation : Nord-Est
Altitude : 1600 m

AccÃ¨s : TÃ©lÃ©phÃ©rique de St Lary (Hiver et Ã©tÃ©) ou par la route qui mÃ¨ne Ã  la station.

Conditions de Vol : Conditions favorables par brise de pente, en dynamique et par vent du nord.

Dangers et difficultÃ©s :CÃ¢bles du tÃ©lÃ©phÃ©rique et lignes EDF. Vent de sud trÃ¨s dangereux. South winds are dangerous !!!!!

name: Mauroux (Pic dels Moros)
desc:
nice and easy take off, grass, nice slope, what you ll have to worry of is more likely to be the aerological conditions The site may sometimes be at the meeting point of breezes from tree valleys : cerdagne (south west), Tet (East), and Capcir (North) : if wind conditions change at take off, it may fast become a bit weird on the site so be carefull.
thermics may start near the landing area : keep your attention all the landing progress long untill you re on the ground.

name: Altenberg - rocher du coucou
desc: Narrow, in a small tree cut, but without particulr tricks.

name: Belmont
desc:
Very good soaring in winter. 

This site is not usable in summer : too much thermic. 

Beginner should avoid this site. There is many trees. Be carefull when flying behind a tree. When wind is more than 10kmh at the parking, don't fly. 
Very strong thermals in summer.

name: Reinhardsmunster
desc:
460 meters.
When arriving in Reinhardsmunster turn left onto the road to Obersteigen. 1 km later, GO STRAIGHT AHEAD and follow the forest road which leads to a car park at an intersection (6 km). 
Once parked turn south and you can choose one of 2 paths that lead to the takeoff. The main one is the one behind the wooden ramp/gate: walk 100m along a forest road then there's a small path going right and diagonally up  the hill for another 100m to the takeoff. There's an INFO PANEL just as you arrive, READ IT :) 
An alternative path from the parking is parallel and above the first one. It starts 20m to the west of the ramp. Always stay left and when you exit the forest and walk another 50m you'll see the takeoff on your left. 

Large and relatively easy take off. A bit steep, covered with astroturf(carpet). Slippery when wet! 

Landing on the right not visble until you take off.

For HG landing is better on the left, at the practice area/spot. Can be seen from the takeooff. Take off a very technical, can be dangerous, in strong wind. 

Magic lift fenomenon on some days in the evening.

name: Gustiberg
desc: Easy

name: Stockenberg
desc: See http://lavl.free.fr/documents/Paragliding-Valley-Thur.pdf

name: Schnepfenried
desc: Easy and large, just before the first ski slopes. Good site the morning until 12h00.

name: Le gaschney
desc:
Le Gaschney (Muhlbach)
Michelin 87, IGN 31

1288 meters

name: Treh markstein
desc:
Very nice and big.

And very big landing at takeoff!

Height : 1200 meters.

name: Quincié en Beaujolais
desc: Large takeoff, but taking off facing the paragliding recommended

name: Mont Dardon Sud
desc: Site Sud et de NO à N

name: Uchon
desc: Short take-off. Reverse launch only.5'walk from the parking. North winds

name: L'ebaudiaz
desc:
alti: 1645m
From 'Notre Dame des MilliÃ¯Â¿Â½res' go up to 'Le Moutonnet'. After take the direction 'l'Ebaudiaz'. Takeoff over the park. be careful about breeze, strong in the end of afternoon.
be careful about high tension wire.

name: Plan de langot
desc:
alti : 1200m
Park the car at the end of the road of  'La ramaz'.
20 min walk.It's a steep climb! dangerous by north wind or when de 'faverges' breeeze is instaled in the 'tamie' valley.

name: Val Pelouse
desc: Park your car at the end of the road, walk 5mn and find a place on the old ski way. thermal site, with high altitude. If it's stable (no thermals) be carreful of wind direction. Attention with moderate to strong South winds!

name: Cormet de roselend
desc:
it's the school slope. If the local school is working, don't fly please.
alti: 2060m
when you are in the pass, park your car and walk to the East. after the hill (on the middle of the pass) you can see the takeoff, with a 'flemme'.

name: Fenetre 7
desc:
Alti : 1430 m
On \'la bÃ¢thie\' village take the \'Biorges\' road and follow \'fenetre 7\' direction. The breeze is more often than not on the beam at the take off.
be careful about breeze, strong in the valley .

name: Montlambert
desc:
alti: 890m
after 12h thermals and breeze can be strong.
Lot's of pilots come here, we thank you to drive slowly and respect the people living on the road to the launch area. This site is fragile! If people complain too much we might lose the right to fly here.
So don't unload your car at the turning point on top. Do it when parked further down the road. Respect nature, the people and regulations! With North wind : The only site (with Courtet) where you can fly around Grenoble. But be careful with strong North wind (above ~20km/h) it's just a little protection and the wind can come quite suddenly. Also be careful when flying over ~1400m, the upper mountain protection can stop and you can find turbulences due to being on the lee side.
With SW wind or W wind, the take off is on the lee side of the takeoff's West side crest, if wind speed is low (below 10km/h) it might still be okay but not by stronger SW or W wind.
With W wind it's flyable, but it might be uncomfortable because of turbulences far above the valley.
In doubt, meet pilots on the site for advices.

name: Le Sire Sud
desc:
Very large and confortable.
Possibility for several pilots to take off at once !

name: Verel pragondran
desc:
Verel Pragondran, cliff take off, be carefull by strong north wind. The begining of fantastic flights. Take off impossible by south wind unless very low wind and very strong thermals.

By North-East or East wind, generally flyable, because protected by the upper cliff, but above 1300m flying conditions might become a bit Rock & Roll

name: Courchevel (Bouc Blanc)
desc: By the top of the Bouc Blanc Drag lift Can get blown out in the middle of the afternoon in summer. There is a balise on the FFVL web site which is at the take off and will give wind speed.

name: Chamoux
desc:
Small takeoff with nice slope. The take-off is located near the highest point in a valley. So you first have to fly through the valley to get the house-thermal at the beginning of the slope.
Lot's of local schools fly there. Good road to the starting place, last 100 meters by foot.
Toplanding possible. You have to pay attention to thermic wind at landing, which can be strong in summer (it comes from south).

name: Revard
desc:
Not very wide, but because it's a hanggliding site also, it is quite long ;-) By strong North wind, going to the south just a bit might put you in impossibility to come back, even to the official landing.
Better stay North from take off.
Webcam: https://www.skaping.com/grandlac/revard

name: Sapenay (pass)
desc:
alti: 897m
From landing: drive to Chindrieux. In the village take the D54 road to \'col du sapenay\'. Cross this pass and park your car, there\'s sign \'dÃ©collage parapente du sapenay\'.

name: L'épine - lac d'aiguebelette
desc:
alti:1150m
after 13h the breeze is coming. Thermic during the afternoon, great flight at the end of the day, over the Aiguebelette lake. The takeoff is under the wind if it's coming from the North, NE, E or SE.
Still flyable and possible to takeoff by North moderate wind (bellow 15km/h) but be careful by higher wind.
By any East component of wind you might find a gentle West breeze at takeoff to let you believe it is fine. Be extra careful, check the wind sock on tree top. You might be able to take off anyway but your flight might be rough and very uncomfortable (even dangerous).

name: Le banchet
desc:
small take off 1 glider on same time, hardly more be careful with North and North-East wind, can be flyable but turbulent.
in south wind really not interesting

name: Bande
desc:
alti: 926m
the landing is far away, be careful.
This site is close between may 15 and june 15. It\'s close too between august and september.

Landing CLOSED, and so, take off closed !

name: Sapenay (south-west)
desc:
from landing drive to Chambotte village. In the village turn to the left, D991b rod, direction St Germain. In St Germain turn to the left, D58b road, direction Cessens. Cross it and take D54 road.When the road stops going up a track goes on your left. Park your car along the road and walk 5mn.
Little field with trees.
on the edge of cliff you can watch the landing area, near the little port. don\'t fly with SE, E to NO wind: rotors on the takeoff.

name: Mont de la chambre
desc: Use the skilifts to get up.

name: Bisanne Sud
desc:
alti: 1940m 
It is near the altitude restaurant. This takeoff is on the top, on the South-East side. Just next to the parking. Later in the day the breeze might be stronger than the thermals and be coming in your back.

name: Plaine Joux (Passy)
desc:
At Plaine Joux.
Wide take off, nicely prepared.
Can be windy the afternoon (valley brise) Avoid flying with strong west, south west wind. 
With west wind coming, the landing is hard to reach, and conditions can be really turbulent.


Very well protected from north wind. It is still flyable even with insane north wind.

Usually west wind is related to foehn. 
ALWAYS check Foehn before flying: VERY turbulent conditions if Foehn is NOT between -4 hPa and +4 hPa. Check foehn forecast on http://www.meteocentrale.ch/fr/meteo/foehn-et-bise/foehn.html

name: Agy plane
desc:
Strong Valley wind and thermic gusts. Nice grassy take off area, locals will be flying, read the FFVL site board-it's in French and English. 1 >Bise wind-that strong NE wind that ruins most valley winds can have some effect.
2 >When Northerlies mix with valley wind if forecasted to blow hard, only good for small wings.
3 >Thermic gusts from the town of Cluses when entering the lower level valley wind and a somewhat technical landing if you approach in the peak of the valley wind, nice and smooth landing later in the evening.

name: Saleve - Telepherique
desc:
'Télépherique' : 
Just on the side of the cable car upper station. Short grassy takeoff.
Orientation : NNE to NNW

name: Morzine
desc:
There are (at least) two options: 
1. The "Super Morzine" launch, marked by several signs for the local tandem operators, on the road and just east of the chair lift
2. The "Ramat" launch, more east-facing and just a few hundred meters up the road, on the right. Both sites are identifiable by wind socks. (See the photo of the sign at Super Morzine for details.)

name: La Clusaz
Les carroz d'araches
desc: grass sloap , 4 glides can taking off together.

name: Plan Praz/ Brevent (Chamonix)
desc:
ATTN: South TO: you must pass UNDERNEATH the cables of the 'le Brevent'-cable car! (> see pix!) Winds > 20kmh from W - N: very turbulent; you'll be flying the lee side!

If on a good day nobody is flying from there - there must be a good reason. Instead go to the Plain Joux site just 20km to the west (near Passy), most likely everybody will be there.

Weather info (or on FFVL frequency):
- http://www.balisemeteo.com/depart.php?dept=74
- http://www.balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=94

name: Les houches -  Prarion
desc: towards NE: grassy, very large

name: Entrevernes
desc: Very small takeoff in a cu-out of forest, enough for 1-2 wings.

name: Chatel Morclan (summit)
desc:
alti: 1975m
on the grass, on the top.
be carefull of the trees. be careful of north wind. big power ligne cross the valley!

name: Les Gets - Mont Chery
desc: https://balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=101

name: le Grand Bornand
desc:
at the very top of the ski resort.
the chairlift can bring you up there from the 'Grand Bornand' village.
Grass field, but steep slope (don't drop your helmet !)
more info here: http://en.legrandbornand.com/paragliding-take-off-area-le-lachat.html http://www.balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=117
https://www.windfinder.com/forecast/le_grand_bornand

name: Mieussy
desc:
several TOs/ -directions available (see link below) weather info (or on FFVL frequency):
- http://www.balisemeteo.com/depart.php?dept=74
- http://www.balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=32

name: Thonon-orcier
desc:
Orcier-Les couteaux N  NE
 ou
orcier -TrÃ¨s le mont N NW W

Thermik express 
at 15 o\'clock ;-)

Do not miss it! Its green land  (remember some rain) 
Bise of lake north or north-east
Good condition North or west wind

name: Saint-Gervais-les-Bains - Mont Paccard
desc: Take off directly in the thermal. Narrow borded with trees

name: Mont Lachat
desc: http://twitter.com/AravisParapente

name: Thollon les memises
desc:
You can reach the take-off with skilift.
Information about opening : http://www.thollonlesmemises.com/

Or you can walk.

name: Montmin (Col de la Forclaz)
desc:
Alti: 1240m
from Annecy go to 'col de la forclaz'. here take the road to the north and park your car after a few meters. Walk 10 mn. With NE wind it's unconfortable.
If nobody fly here, you can ask yourself why. It's the busiest site in France, with St Hilaire du Touvet.

name: Marnaves - parapente
desc: Cliff launch. Not for beginners. Dont fly with east wind - turbulent

name: St Antonin Noble Val
desc:
Several takeoff points to suit wind direction.
Launch from either side of gorge with good lift from sheer faces.
Easy access to takeoff points. No need to carry your gear too far!!
Gorge is about 300 metres above valley floor.

Plusieurs dÃ©collages en fonction de la direction du vent, des deux cÃ´tÃ©s des gorges. Bonne composante verticale (parois abruptes).
 AccÃ¨s facile aux points de dÃ©collage. Pas besoin de transporter votre Ã©quipement trop loin!
 DÃ©collage environ 300 mÃ¨tres au-dessus du fond de la vallÃ©e. Non that I can see but I'm no expert. It seems to suit beginners and experts alike.
Check the website..For Hang Gliding and in French but looks like good info regarding takeoff and windsock location etc.

name: Signes - agnis
desc: on the first hill, above Signes

name: Bargemon - col du belhomme
desc:
Go to the 'col of belhomme'
Park your car there.
Then follow the indication 'table d'orientation'.
15 mn later you are on the take off.

Takeoff is rather small.

name: Le Mai - Cap Sicié
desc:
The take off place and landing place are the same, you must fly only if you are sure you can land at the take off place.
Even on smoothly condition wind, strong wind can come fast. 

Flyable on E wind direction. During flies, have a permanent look to the white horses on the sea.
When coming fast to the coast wing is going up strongly.
Landing time is coming.

name: Ste Anastasie
desc:
Large take off place on the St Quinis massif.
South side, visible from Landing place.

Possibility to land near the take off.
Needs good skill of landing on small area.
High trees all around.

Details here: 
https://tasie-parapente.club/le-site/

ONLY 4x4 vehicles can use the very bad track leading to take off. Flyable site when wind is coming from SSE & S.
For E & O winds impossible to fly due to high downwind on the relief.

name: Arfuyen
desc:
Observations/Dangers : Site du matin pratiquable uniquement en condition calme moins de 20 km /h de vent de face - TrÃ¨s turbulent en condition thermiques. Interdit en pÃ©riode de chasse : selon rÃ©glementation en vigueur pour ces pÃ©riodes. Atterrissage : en fonction des cultures, passer impÃ©rativement Ã  l'atterrissage avant de monter au dÃ©collage pour reconnaissance. Stationnement : Hors voies de circulation et propriÃ©tÃ©s privÃ©es. 
AccÃ¨s/cartes : AccÃ¨s Ã  pied par le col de la chaine et le dÃ©part du GR. Ensuite sentier non balisÃ© mais bien marquÃ© au sol jusqu'au dÃ©collage. Temps de marche : 30 mn. Difficile d'accÃ¨s pour les deltas et rigides (sentier escarpÃ©)

name: Ballon d Alsace
desc:
3 Take Off:
The North West one (Presle) is located at the top, follow the small path at the top (located after the statue).
To get to the Nort-Est take off, just continue walking on the path for 300 meters.
For the Est take off, continue to drive for 800 meters after the top of the Ballon d'Alsace, the take off is on your left in the field. Max altitude during week-ends : 3425meters, during the week : 1890m or 2450m.

On NE takeoff, beware of fast loss of altitude, whenever a thermal on the other side of the valley bursts.

name: Chevre roche
desc:
Décollage type falaise.
Attention au rideau d'arbres sous le décollage.

name: Saint Hilaire du Touvet
desc:
North take off is a comfortable big carpet, but may be downwind of the thermic blowing in front.
South take off's in grass and you may find more facing thermal wind here than in north take off. be careful with South wind.
In spring, conditions can be quite hard, specialy near the cliff.

name: Plan de l'Aiguille (Chamonix)
desc:
West oriented. Site has been greatly improved (> see pix).
Beware of the electic line and the cables of the cable car. There are often very(!) strong thermal conditions. The wind can rise very quickly in the valley. Welcome to the mountains !

name: Allevard-south takeoff
desc: Allevard South be careful of the gradient in 'la Mirande'. Sometime it's south wind on the takeoff but breeze direction on the landing area...

name: Allevard-les Plagnes
desc:
on the top of the ski station. go by car to 'super-collet' and take the chair lift (open in winter and July-august). takeoff on the grass, near the ski tow. Don't go down in the little valley under the takeoff (veyton valley), you will have big difficult to go out. No landing :-)
If you land at the dike, be careful: it's forbiden and dangerous to fly over the lake. The breeze could be strong near the ground and you will land in the water...

name: Varces - Pré du Four
desc: alti 1220m. be carfull with strong wind, especially south wind.

name: Col du Glandon
desc:
If it\'s breeze or north: on the neck, just near the road. Walk 5 minuts.
If it\'s south wind fly between the \'col du glandon\' and the \'col de la croix de fer\', over the D526 road. Be careful about the south wind, sometimes it\'s bad conditions.

name: job-ambert Cornillon
desc:
alti: 1150m
a clearing in the forest, easy for 2 glids in front!

name: job-ambert le bien
desc:
alti: 1000m
easy little flight, not so high when it\'s windy. don\'t fly when it\'s too windy.

name: job-ambert Rocher de la Pause
desc:
alti: 1500m
it seams to be a very good site for waggas if it\'s west wind... if it\'s windy stay on the top, don\'t land in \'Fossat\'.

name: Chatel Morclan (under the top)
desc:
alti: 1900m
follow the path to the west direction on the top, after the chair life. Big slope, be careful!!!
only in summer. be careful of north wind. big power ligne cross the valley!

name: Volmerange-les-Mines
desc:
Landing on top is possible, but not in the field behind take-off.

There are 2 take-offs: E and SE. Site can be dangerous when the wind is stronger than 30 Kph on Luxembourg Airport.

Site can also be dangerous when the wind is stronger than 15 Kph and less than 45 Kph.

Landing behind the take-off is forbidden and very dangerous, notably when the wind is strong!

Take care to the venturi that are located at the north of the take-off and at the south (above the road from Kanfen to Volmerange).

name: Serpaton - Gresse en Vercors
desc:
Very big, with grass.
early in season you can find snow on the road. Be sure it's not, if not you will walk long time... be carefull with west wind, you are under the wind.
If you wait too much on the take off the breeze can coming in your back, from 'Gresse en vercors' valley.

name: Petit Drumont
desc:
1200m
Paragliding : 47Â°54'02
Delta : 47Â°53'53 Venturi in UrbÃ¨s valley.

name: Malay le Grand
desc: Nice grassy take off

name: Le Murier 4 Seigneurs
desc: grass on a hill with trees around.

name: chatel-mens
desc:
Alti:
big grass area on the top of the 'Chatel' summit. walk 1 h.
from Mens take the D66 road to the north-east. Follow it until 'CordÃ¯Â¿Â½ac' and take a track to the south. Stop under the summit and walk to finish. it's flyable when north wind is too strong to fly on other sites in this district.

name: Montgirod-Arcachat
desc:
2000m
When you are under the power lines along the road after the cheese farm- go to your right on a 4x4 track and make a judgement on where to launch from off the steeper slope

1900m (GPS co-ords)
Normally use this launch on the far SW part of the mountain away from the power lines and easier to access. Go just past the refuge and look for the little wind streamer on the steeper gradient next to some small shrubs, park your car on the corner. Spring and Autumn : Hunting season, do not go to the toilet in the trees up the mountain.

Summer: Venturi in the valley.

Winter : foehn wind days-you shouldn't be out there anyway.

name: Charande-la moliere
desc:
alti: 1709m.
from parking walk 30mn on the crest to the south. Takeoff on your left, on the top.
Just for 1 or 2 glides. big grass Slop. nothing

name: Mundolsheim
desc:
100m wide start place to fly, touch and play. Very fun. Wide area with grass to rest. 

2km wide soaring place.

IN TMA STRASBOURG, DON'T FLY UPPER THAN 150 METERS ABOVE GROUND. Wind can become stronger. Don't fly direct above the ridge. 
Do not train close to the ridge, risks of unwanted take off !

name: Montgellafrey
desc:
Alti: 1790m
Grass slope, walk a few minutes. If you wait too long you will have the valley wind in your back... it\'s more difficult to take-off ;-)

name: Beaulieu sur layon
desc: NO take-off/ flight allowed any more until further notice!!

name: Vallon Pont d\'Arc
desc:
For coming in the site : When you comes from the O you take a small Road behind the most COOPERATIVE of Ardeches's Wines just before 
Entering in the Samll Town Called 'Vallon Pont D'Arc' (the best site for Kayak Canoe)...

You must walk with your bag, you've 2 Take off at two different levels (it depends of your Body Health !! ;-))) 

1st Level Take off : 75 m (very low but interesting when it's windy in Soaring)

2nd Level : near 150 m hight better for Thermals conditions Be carefull of th 'under the wind' if it's windy

name: Banon
desc: One for East wind, one for South.

name: Refuge de l Aigle

refuge altitude: 3450m.
This is a climb in itself. With some rock walls,
the Amieux cliff and the ascending of the Tabuchet glacier all requiring the presence of a mountain guide. Your effort is well rewarded as the refuge is situated in a climbers paradise, at the foot of the Meije summits and in the middle of the glaciers.
duration of climbing: 5h30
vertical: 1800m.

name: Avoriaz
desc:
Near the entry of Avoriaz, on right after 'Pierre et Vacances''s check'in, a little place to park car, it was built by PGHM handgliders in late 70's. It's short, but the glide is suitable to take off in 2-3 feet run. The wind is usually back, cause of the big thermal just in front. You have to glide over the trees and just after the power kick your wing. In the morning go to right, near the golf, in afternoon and after go at left close to the cliff. BAD: East winds (stranges effects), to much back wind at take off, poor thermals.
BAD: South Winds (can hide 'Foehn')
Good: North
Very Good: North East (gret thermals conditions)
Good: North West
Average: West and South West (can hide a 'little Foehn')

name: le Puet
desc:
At 10min by feet of the Napoleon road in St-vallier de Thiey. A private site of the school and the local club. But all pilots are welcome if you are completly informed about rules. Possible to find the rules at 'Ciel de Siagne' or spiritparapente.fr
Ideal for soaring, thermals not too strong, XC an flat XC.
Maybe the new better site during winther, it's possible to fly with East, West, south and little north! North and North-est if it's strong!

name: Sospel - Tete de la lavina
desc:
Take off before 11h00
After it is in the shadow so with backwind.

The Lavina launch is good for beginners, with its South-Easterly orientation facilitating morning flights, and the vast grassy land below take-off allowing for easy landings. Later in the morning, as the thermals get stronger, it becomes a good XC site too.

name: Le Méruz
desc:
Take-off 'Le Méruz' Usable in almost any flyable conditions but its full potential is unleashed the morning (S-E face).
As the day progressed, the valley breeze becomes stronger and stronger, making it harder and uncomfortable to find thermals.

In conditions of strong North wind (NW,N,NE), reaching the upper crest might prove quite uncomfortable (Lee side). You can still escape however lower than the crest, but that's trickier

name: Serres Airoport
desc: No takeoff here. Just for landing.

name: Marlens
desc:
This is a low altitude takeoff, you are most likely flying in the breeze layer, any low wind direction will do.
If you are flying in winter or Autumn, this takeoff is South oriented, you might not be in a good spot for North wind

name: Serres Beaumont
desc:
Good, early, in the morning, when the sun light the rocks which are just under the TV transmitter. 
WARNING : be very carefull before taking your decision => take off is under the north, the west and the south wind. 
WARNING : when east wind (other than brise) is facing the takeoff, it can be difficult to reach a comfortable landing. Be very carefull. In the summer, avoid to flight after 12h00 in this area : take off can be smooth and ok while it can be very dangerous in the valley (strong brise, and too strong thermals).

Un déco Sud plus pentu. 
Ces trois décos sont accessibles aux handicapés. ometimes, in the evening is coming a strong wind from the south-East.

name: Oeillon Est
desc:
Le décollage est assez court et un peu technique. Il n'est pas adapté aux débutants. Il peut être un bon départ en cross avec un début de convection le matin parfois tôt. Il y a plusieurs atterrissages sur ce site.

The takeoff is quite short and a bit technical. It is not suitable for beginners. It can be a good start in cross with a beginning of convection in the morning sometimes early. There are several landings on this site. Quand il n'y a pas de vent, il faut décoller tôt car la brise vient ensuite de derrière dès la fin de matinée.

Il est possible d'y voler toute la journée quand le vent est Est ou SE


When there is no wind, take off early because the breeze comes from behind at the end of the morning.

It is possible to fly there all day when the wind is East or SE.

name: Leucate -Sémaphore Falaise EST
desc:
Inside a little valley and just front of the 'SÃ©maphore' you can find the take off (NE-E orientation). It's also possible to take off on the second face of the valley, 5o meters further, with an orientation SE. But be careful : maximum orientation with SE is 125Â°. Don't fly over that orientation.
Generally :
Minimum wind fly is 17 km/h.
Higher fly are between 25 and 30 km/h 
Maximum wind fly is 35 km/h.
Timing : 12h to 15h. The wind can stop quickly sometimes. You fly 40m up to the top in general. If it's your first time, go landing when you're around 25m high.

plat avec pierres et chênes kermès mais devenant plus en plus propre. Ne pas voler à gauche du déco , raz des arbres.  Risque d etre sous le vent de la montagne en face. 
Et présence d'un thermique puissant et traitre.

name: Garlaban
desc:
The take-offs are quite short but do not present any particular difficulties. General orientation: East to South. Dangerous in North, NW and NE winds and in Westerly winds. Favourable with easterly, east-south-easterly, south-south-easterly and south-south winds. 

In breezy conditions and in the absence of strong weather winds, flight is possible in the middle of the morning. However, the southwest sea breeze returns fairly quickly at midday, more or less early depending on the season due to the proximity of the sea, making flying turbulent and inadvisable.

Technical takeoff : short run and flat place to raise the aile (20 meters), then immediate abrupt slope. Nice to have a flight and walk. Landing zone can be reached very easily, however, take care as soon as the brise valley is installed. Morning summer site, when this mountain side is illuminated by the rising sun.
Warning : the takeoff place is on a private place. No contract with the owner. Contact Gilles (who is flying) 06 82 86 00 99 and who is a owner of a part of the Bergenbach mountain just very close to this takeoff.

name: le Chalvet (Saint Andre les Alpes)
desc: The main launch SW/ W is relatively steep, and thermic from around midday. The wind on take-off can be strong, particularly later on when the valley winds become established. When the thermic activity dies down again, very pleasant evening soaring is often available until it gets dark. South-East launches are easy, very large. Lake landing can be turbulent in a rather strong N or NW meteo wind (Mistral). In fact, by light Mistral, no troubles by starting from the SW launch, but when conditions are getting only windy,we oftenly catch a microwave. with a light North, it is flyable too (North launch), but no real interest. Wind info (alos on FFVL frequency): http://www.balisemeteo.com/depart.php?dept=04 http://www.balisemeteo.com/balise.php?idBalise=109 For full access to all the Saint Andre weather including wind speed on launch etc on a single page visit: http://flystandre.com/webcam-weather/
