makes the site good for any level in accordance with the different moments of the da NORTH WIND is not good

name: Montagna Grande N
desc: easy

name: Porzus
desc: First go in Porzus, follow uneven  road for 1km. Leave your car and walk for 200mt (west direction)

name: Chianocco
desc:
Takeoff reachable by 2min walk from the road which leads from Chianocco to Pavaglione. Go up the road, pass Frazzione Combette, continue upwards, make 6 curves, tontinue on the more or less 600m straight piece of the road, then make 2 more curves and stop right after the 2nd. You will see a small path going into bushes west from the right-turning curve. Takeoff site is there rechable by a very short walk. Park the car on the side of the road. Coordinates for parking: 45.155169,7.183293
Takeoff is big enough to open 3 gliders simultaneously. Absolutely do not fly with foen winds. Check the weather forecasts before. It is also not reccomendedto fly if a foen or westerly wind is forecasted to enter within next 6-12  hrs. You can easly understand it by observing pressure difference between Italy and France on pressure charts.

name: Corio
desc:
Coordinates: N45.338362, E7.543034
Altitude: 1270 m
Exposure: SE
Not very steep but also not very big field. There is an alternative takeoff site just on the NE site in case N/NE winds are present.

Do not attempt to soar at low altitude right on the right from the takeoff. In case of loss of altitude there are no emergency landing sites.
The best is trying to get thermals just on the left from takeoff (over parking) or straight ahead over the antenna towers. DO not fly with W or NW winds, particularly in foen wind conditions. Even though on takeoff site it may seem calm, on landing site foen wind may exceed 10m/s intensity.

In hot season thunderstorms may form extremely quickly and pose danger - suck-in, strong easter winds or severe wind gusts on landing site or other places in valley (even if thunderstorm stays over mountains 10km away).
Do not take off if cumulonimbus clouds can be observed nearby!

name: Monte Tenchia
desc: There are several points of departure but the best are on top of Mount Tench. About 1 km beyond the antennas. Enormous grassland and excellent wind Very dangerous with strong north wind

name: Monte Paularo
desc: About 30 minutes walk from Castel Valdaier. Under cellular antenna. Extensive lawns. Easy take-off Do not fly with winds from the north

name: Rosbella (Boves)
desc: Rosbella

name: Tocco Da Casauria
desc:
Tocco mountain

The road to the take-off is not the best but it runs without any problem with any type of car. After leaving the car to the parking area you have to walk uphill about 100 meters.
The flying site of Tocco is normally used from March to October and enjoys excellent weather conditions.
You get to fly in the early afternoon from 13.30 / 14:30 thanks to the arrival of the sea breeze.
It's a flying site suitable for all pilots and offers excellent opportunities for cross country; you can reach Mount Morrone and the best pilots the Gran Sasso.

name: Rocca Calascio Panettone
desc:
Rocca Calascio

Possible to drive in a normal 2-wheel drive car all the way to takeoff. Or park on the main road and walk up the track for 500m. Takeoff is a very large shallow sloping field. Nice and easy. In summer time is only for advanced pilot. 

In the middle of the day the weather conditions are very strong

name: Rueglio
desc:
Takeoff sites are located on nearby mountain Bossola which is over 1400m high on the north from Rueglio.
Several takeoff possibilities along the gravel road, big takeoff field at the end of the road. Do not fly in foen or in strong N or W wind conditions.

Flying with slight northern winds in high altitude is still possible due to valley breeze at flight altitude.

Thunderstorms can form very quickly on nearby mountains. Sometimes they are blocked from view by nearby cumulus clouds.

name: Moncuni
desc:
Takeoff is just below on the north-western side of the peak (the cross) of Moncuni hill. Do not fly with foen winds.
Beware that entering valle Susa in summer afternoons means facing its strong walley breeze winds (can be over 50kmh)

name: Monte Fallito
desc: small area but easy take off

name: Trucetti-Giaveno
desc:
Pretty big takeoff field with exposure to NE and SE, use according to wind direction.

Coordinates: N45.07620 E7.34753
Elevation: 977m ASL * do not fly with foen winds. 
* thunderstorms may form very quickly on unstable days
* beware of strong valley breeze in Valle Susa, expecially in june, jully.

name: Ciavanis-Chialamberto
desc:
At 1770m altitude on the northern slope of the valley over the village of Vonzo.
Pretty big and smooth takeoff field suitable for beginners, tandems and hang gliders. Multiple gliders can be easily opened at the same time. Do not fly with strong western or north-west winds. Absolutely do not fly with foen winds (also from west, bet extremely strong and turbulent, strong rotors etc.)

On unstable days (particularly late spring, early summer) thunderstorms can develop extremely quickly. 

Valley breeze in the afternoon may make it hard to get back from the end of the valley to the landing site.

name: Firenzuola
desc: Carpinaccio. Little mountain near Poggio Tignoso. 20 minuts by feet for the top take off. strong sud , strong nord.

name: Monte Soglio
desc:
On the peak of Monte Soglio (1971 m). The peak is a big smooth grass-field which makes the takeoff very easy.
If flying in evening, make sure you launch before the wind changes direction from the back (west). It is quite hard to outrun it then. Strong NW and foen winds. o not fly with them. Rotors are present just below the summit.

name: Monte Musinè
desc:
Rather inclined and smooth takeoff field from the eastern crest of the mountain. Takeoff is to the south. Easily reachable by approx 30-40min trekking from the central square of the Caselette village. 
As of autumn 2011, there is an Italian flag installed on the takeoff site also serving as a windsock. Do not fly with strong westerly and especially with foen winds. Check the weather forecast, foen may take you by surprise, appear in just 30min out of nowhere and produce up to 70kmh very turbulent wind. You don't want to fly it even by a speedglider.

name: Campotenese
desc: Once you reach the peak of Mountain La Serra, where some telecom antennas are installed, you can choose to launch from the NW side or the SE side. NW side is the official one but sometimes you can fly on the other side facing the city of Morano Calabro and the landing place is close to a big fountain. Fantastic site with some important restrictions. The take off and the landing place are very close and allow to go up and down all day. It is preferable to be at the takeoff site early in the morning 9:00 am in summer and 10:00-11:30 in winter. Please never attempt flying when the wind is above 30 Km/h because it gets stronger easily reaching 70 km/h from NW. If you are flying and you think that the wind is getting stronger leave the mountain crest and fly to the centre of the valley where the wind is lower and you can land safely. If you choose about flying by yourself please take the weather conditions into consideration. This place offers good cross-country flights and always bring friends with you, you will enjoy it.

name: Belvedere Marittimo
desc: Very easy

name: Col di Tenda
desc:
near fortress wind info: 
frequency 144.987.5  or call (0039)3451389512.

name: Königsangerspitze
desc: can be reached only on foot http://wetter.provinz.bz.it/default.asp?404;wetter/suedtirol.asp

name: Colle di Fenestrelle
desc:
1) At colle de Finestre.
Any place around is OK. The best to takeoff on the north from parking (from the road of the footpath)

2) any suitable place a little walk up from the plain Do not fly with foen or northerly winds. Extremly dangerous. Always check the wether forecast before and pay attention to pressure difference between France and Italy. In case of westerly wind, the wind direction and intensity may seem OK at takeoff but actually there is a huge rotor on leeward side of the mountain.

name: La Riposa
desc: Few meters from the refuge La Riposa big and smooth grass field. Lots of takeoff possibilities all around. Do not even think about flying in presence of foen wind. Check the weather forecast, if foen is forecasted in next 24 hours it is better not to take the risks.

name: Bolognetta
desc: VERY EASY TO REACH YOU CAN FLY WITH NORD - NORDEST - NORDOVEST

name: Praille
desc:
Grassy field next to the road (visible from road) with some trees on both sides.
High voltage power line just below the takeoff but it does not disturb or endanger the takeoff.
Please note this is not an official takeoff, use it when the grass is short or when no livestock is present. Always be kind if meet the landlord. Strong valley breeze will almost certainly make the flight (and landing) impossible on sunny summer day afternoons (even after 11AM). So use this flying site only in the morning and monitor the breeze intensity.

Never fly with northerlies, westerlies and foen winds. Very turbulent and strong.

name: Creto
desc: North, North west, North east and East winds are dangerous.

name: Rignano Garganico
desc:
Easy both for paraglide and hanglide.
Top landing is possible.

name: Alpe  Bill (Macugnaga)
desc:
Features: The take off is very nice although not large. The slope is constant without any technical difficulty.

Notes: The takeoff is not feasible in the winter because it is impossible to achieve with the snow.

Obstacles: None.

Top Landing: No.

Notes on the flight: The cable car is open from November to April and from mid June to mid September. The ticket includes a return if you do not take off Do not you fly with: In the presence of wind directions from the North, Northwest, West, moderate to strong, the possibility of formation of rotors and air turbulence.

name: Montoso Rucas
desc:
1480 mt asl
Big grass slope , it is possible to open up to 8-10 gliders at the same time. Suitable for beginners. Easy top landing with appropriate conditions.
Big car parking. It is not necessary walking to reach the takeoff.
Takeoff oriented SE Do not  fly with W-NW-N-NE winds

name: Plan-Belle-Crète
desc:
Absolutely no flying, even not thinking, when foehn or string norderly winds are present.
Strong valley breeze may also be a concern.

name: Mombarcaro
desc:
Rather wide field, just 50m from parking and with the landing site visible from it. Avoid flying with strong, especially southern, winds.
The wind at the landing site sometimes gets quite strong.

name: Montefalcone nel Sannio - North
desc:
Takeoff is very steep, allowing easy and clean takeoff, both single and tandem. It's made of grass. The main exposition is north-northeast, however when the dominant tends to blow from east, a walk of 30 meters take to another takeoff directly to east.
Instead, when in southern range, there's the south takeoff directly behind. For the western takeoff pilots should transfer back to montefalcone and climb to the Montefalcone nel Sannio - South takeoff. It's a very easy flight, however pay attention to wind gusting, in order to avoid chandelier effect.

name: Schwarzseespitze - Rittner Horn
desc:
grass field - SW http://wetter.provinz.bz.it/
Wind station -> http://wetter.provinz.bz.it/hoehenwindstationen.asp?stat_stid=105
Webcam -> https://rittnerhorn.it-wms.com/

name: Panni
desc: Distante poche centinaia di metri da un comodo parcheggio

name: Livigno
desc: All around on the top of the mountains

name: San Donato Val di Comino
desc: Only Hanglider; paragliding walking up and fly down

name: Monte Vandalino
desc: Takeoff from the top next to the meteo station, or below it towards the east. A very big and grassy field.

name: Tremezzo-Crocione-Bellagio
desc:
From the top of Monte Crocione, or if want to walk some meters higher, also from Monte Tremezzo is OK. Do no fly with Northern wind!

In spring and summer thunderstorms can form very quickly.

name: Pian dell' Alpe
desc:
Smooth takeoff, suitable for 2 wings simultaneous preparation and launch.
After the launch, soar the slope to the right to gain some altitude. Once you are over the road, it should become easier.

name: Forte di Fenestrelle
desc:
From the road - a 20-30minutes walk-up.
2 principal takeoffs
1) smooth and grassy saddle 
2) top of the crest (little prickly bu 150m higher).

From the higher site you should be able to arrive on the top of Forte di Fenestrelle in a glide. In the summer the valley breeze gets strong after 11:00, by that time you should have been landed.
In autumn (October and later) it is flyable at any time of the day.

name: Pollina - Decollo basso/alto
desc: Quite difficult take-off! Very small in width and length, right below the road with trees on the right hand side.

name: Colli di San Fermo (Casazza)
desc: HUGE field

name: Pila - Plan Praz
desc:
1min walk below the Plan Praz cableway station.
Take off towards the tower. No flying with strong northerlies and foen winds. Extrelemly turbulent and dangerous.

Do not fly in the central valley in summer months' afternoons - the valley breeze is likely to be too strong for paraglidier.
Check the wind speed and direction before you descent down in the valley.

name: Pila - Chamole (Aosta)
desc: From ski-slope, walk slightly lower to clear the cables.

name: Caseppa
desc:
Nice smooth field, enough for a single paraglider start at a time.
Start only in presence of thermal wind from the front if you are going for a thermal XC.

name: Rivalba
desc: Hill behind Rivalba.

name: Colliano
desc: Wide and steep area, takes wind from S-SW-SE, quite a few opportunities to move from cliff to cliff to find the right place to take off from. Conditions usually get harder in the warmest hours of the day.

name: Prato Fiorito
desc:
N 44Â° 03.256
E 10Â° 37.199
A very large area at the top of Mt.Prato Fiorito

name: Monte Blum - Clusone
desc:
Big grassy field, south exposure.

For getting to the takeoff there are 2 options:

1) By club's shuttle jeep. The apoitmnet is at landing field, or on the parking nearby it (200m to the east). Costs 10eur. 

2) By walking. Approox 1,5 hrs. ALthough possible, usually not the preferred way of getting there.

Goiing up by private vehicles is not allowed due to park's regulations, and the road quality requires an off-road vehicle. Thunderstorms may quickly buid up in spring/summer days.

name: San Giacomo di Andrate
desc:
Wide launch permitting  simultaneous TOs of 4 or even more gliders. The upper part is flat and the slope becomes very steep at the edge, a good glider control skills are recommended.
For HG: ramp available Do not fly with N and NW winds, and when a danger of föhn wind entry exists.

In spring thunderstorms may develop very quickly. Always keep an eye on cumulus clouds development, and in case of over-development it's a good idea to land.

name: Stribugliano
desc: Stribugliano is the main takeoff of the aeroclub Contronembo. It's completely made of grass, open wide. It has a good tilt for takeoff, both single and tandem, hanglider.

name: La Pesse
desc:
Either the smallshallow field, or the one little bit steeper 30m to the east. 1) Westerlies, northerlies or foen winds. Do not fly! Extremly turbulent and dangerous. If forecasts give northerlies but on takeoff you find a gusty wind from south, it's a rotor.

2) Valley breeze: from april until september this site is flyable in the morning (until 11 or 12 mostly) or in late evening. In the afternoon the valley breeze can be up to 50kmh strong and not survivable by a paraglider. If it happens to fly in mid day, make top-landing on the fields at Verrayes - Frazzione Hers.

name: Andrate (Castagna)
desc:
Takeoff is from a piece of road, techical and a good glider control is required. There is space just for 1 takeoff at a time, and maximum 2 pilots can prepare the gliders simultaneously. Have your wing up and stabilized before jumping off the 'edge', you don't want to end up in bushes...
Certainly, not for beginners.

name: Rifugio Perugia
Monticchio
desc: Huge field, space for thousands of gliders. Takeoff everywhere. Not very steep though, not suitable for HG or low efficiency old wings. Do not fly with foen winds! Extremly turbuent and dangerous.

name: Col Bione
desc:
Do not go in Valle Susa for landing in later spring and summer months and mid-day hours, string valley breeze may ruin the landing.

Do not attempt to fly with Foen winds! What may appear as good breeze may actually be the ascending part of rotor.

name: Gualdo Tadino
desc: Mount Serrasanta (PG)

name: Toirano
desc: Wide take off easy driving to Avoid flying with North winds

name: Givoletto
desc:
Beware of stones and small bushes.

Reachable by car (5min from Givoletto) and then approx 25min walk.

name: Lo Riondè
desc: Lo RiondÃ¨ alpine shelter

name: Bassano - Camillo
desc: 2 km before Bassano south - da Bepi

name: San Bernardo di Mendatica
desc:
The take-off a south/east facing grassy meadow, wide enough to allow 5 paraglider take-offs at the same time. There are several wind indicators. It is relatively easy to perform top-landing in dynamic conditions. Behind the take-off area there is a horizontal lawn which can be used for pre-flight checks of the paraglider. There are a few benches available to the public.
Beware of the 130 kVolt power line located behind the take-off vertical, at a height of about 40 metres. Beware of the 130 kVolt power line passing over the vertical of the take-off, at a height of about 40 metres, which is only annoying in the event of a top landing or sailing near the take-off.
Beware of the slight slope in the last few metres in front of the landing, recently extended landing field.

name: Pedana Delta 3
desc:
Hang glider take off from springboard. Paraglider take off only with ground assistance.
Wind from south!

name: Beigua
desc: 20min walking from parking. Take off is inside the protected natural area 'Parco del Beigua'

name: S.Antonio - Costa del Mito
desc: Decollo esposto ad ovest,si decolla per poi uscire fuori e andare veleggiare sul chilometrico costone della spiaggia del Mingardo direttamente sul mare.In giornate primaverili buona attivitÃ  termica con possibilitÃ  di quote importanti (700 800 metri) a picco sul mare.Dal lato opposto del crinale c'Ã¨ anche un decollo esposto ad est che permette comunque di decollare anche con venti da quadranti opposti a quelli con cui si vola e di volarevolgendo lo sguardo al centro di Marina di Camerota.Il decollo Ã¨ raggiungibile con qualsiasi veicolo.

name: Ciglio - Cardile
desc:
Davvero perfetto,ampio,degno dei migliori prati alpini e sempre in manutenzione.Panorama spettacolare che va dai monti fino al mare.Ultimi 500 metri da raggiungere a piedi o in 4x4. Stazione meteo nel centro abitato di Cardile

http://www.campanialive.it/dati-meteo.asp?stazione=cardile

name: montelago
desc:
you could reach the top from montelago, arriving from serravalle di chienti
43.137N, 12.992E

name: Mombarone
desc:
Takeoff possible below the mountain refugee, at about 2300 m. 

Directions available are SW and S... just choose a place on the grass (be careful with rocks!) 
Possible takeoff also facing E (it's more like NE...) with nil to light winds. This is the best takeoff to open your wing, because there is a little flat spot Foehn winds (northerly)
Cloudbase covering the takeoff

name: Praglia
desc:
Close to road SP4 going to 'Piani di Praglia' from Genova-Bolzaneto (A7 exit)
Suitable parking just behind take off. Avoid with strong South wind

name: Bielmonte oasi zegna
desc: foehn (N-wind)

name: Orgiano-Polveriera
desc: Strong breeze in spring and summer.

name: Romitello
desc: Get up to Romitello village, drive through it via 'Via Romitello' up to the pick-nick place

name: Cefalù
desc: Initial part flat thereafter few meters to stop in a gentle slope.

name: Alto
desc:
Take off 1) 44Â°07'21.32' N 7Â°59'48.32' E 1092m
Take off 2) 44Â°07'17.97' N 7Â°59'11.61' E 1214m

Large green field, is possible Fly with E or SE or S.
Not fly with N or NW

name: Tognola
desc:
To arrive on takeoff area you need to ride with the Cabin Lift ( white cabin lift) check this website to see prices of tickets http://www.tognola.it/ , when you will be near the Refuge Tognola, walk towards the Button Lift and go until the finish of it. You will see a big Antenna (Red and White) after 50mt you will see the pole with anemometer and you will be on takeoff area. Is a flat area where you can lay down your glide. Not really steep for the firts steps, after it will be steep. Sometimes, if the wind is not strong you have to run to take off. Wide grass field facing south east. The anemometer with wind arrow is located on the right side on top of a pole. It is not really good when the thermal is too strong. 
The thermals start at 09:00 until 12:00 (we advice to start to fly in the morning)
With Wind from North, normally it is good for winter flight. In summer generally valley breeze come from southeast, as the takeoff area. Weather Info: 
http://www.meteotrentino.it 
http://www.arpav.veneto.it 
http://www.tognola.it/

Pay particular attention to moderate winds from West - North and North-West in general, in these conditions, the area becomes very dangerous and turbulent in summer. In any case, the flight in spring and summer in the central hours (12:00 to 16:00) is only recommended for experienced pilots sometime its easy to get RainStorm during the central hours.) just check the weather before to plan to come here.  Anyway towards Morning it is possible for less experienced pilots to make a beautiful soaring flights (South, Southeast Takeoff).

name: Cima Agnelezza - Lago Calaita
desc:
Weather Info: 
http://www.meteotrentino.it 
http://www.arpav.veneto.it

name: Palamonda - Colverde - San Martino di Castrozza
desc:
Weather Info: 
http://www.meteotrentino.it 
http://www.arpav.veneto.it

name: Montemale
desc: Montemale

name: Ara della Regina
desc: This site work whit mistral wind when it's plus of 12 kn

name: Monte San Giacomo - Breccanecca
desc: Easy to reach, only 10min walking on a good condition and almost flat track

name: Chiodo fisso - Passo del Chiodo
desc:
Passo del Chiodo close to Passo del Tomarlo, Santo Stefano d'Aveto 

Easy to reach by car. The takeoff is a nice grassy field directly next to the road.

name: Piombino
desc:
Takeoff is on a small cliff behind a beach.  
It's exposure is South-South-East, exactly in front of Elba Island. 
It's a tricky takeoff because there are bushes from left to right and on top, so the operating space is reduced to a minimum. However it can be flown without much stress if you takeoff on the lower part. The south-east wind in my zone isn't in average less than 25-35 km/h, so be careful to see the weather station correctly before reaching it.

name: Gavorrano
desc:
Takeoff is on top on monte Calvo, above Gavorrano city. It's a very nice and super easy takeoff, looking the gulf of follonica and the mighty elba island. Just walk up, set up, and takeoff. We fly this site when the NW wind blow from 15-25 km/h, however in summer we usually takeoff on sunset. We do not have a wheater station there however the NW wind is the gulf breeze, so very easy to control.
Avoid wind gusting 30 km/h.

name: Castelmauro - NorthEast
desc:
Takeoff is on the east side of monte Mauro, and the exposure space from NE to ESE. It's made of grass and has a perfect tilt to launch. It's open wide.
South takeoff is also possible, but in this condition prefer the south Castelmauro takeoff, much easier to reach. Avoid takeoff with western wind. Castelmauro works better with easter dominant. Also pay attention to the very strong condition that you can find in sunny day, especially in summer.

name: Castelmauro - South
desc: Takeoff it's made of grass, with some rocks. It's perfect for beginners and for schools. Be aware that in this zone of Italy the dominant come from North-East, so when you're in southern configuration, the condition overall should be from strong to ultra strong. It's not due to lee situation, but from that south condition comes probably from perturbation in the air that make her quite unstable. It's not uncommon to fly in the early morning in +3 m/s thermal, and flown in 50 km/h south breeze in the afternoon.

name: Le Cornate
desc: Takeoff is little and slightly rocky, however can takeoff one wing per time without any particular skills. This little mountain has only one exposition, to the west. Wind must be perfect to takeoff.

name: Monte Lesima
desc:
It's 200 mt before big white radar air traffic
The right side is the NE mountain side. Takeoff and flight is good with NE winds.
Pay attention to the forecast, to avoid wind speed increase during flight.

name: Miranda
desc:
Take off altitude 1200 mt coordinates:
N 41Â°38.308   E  014Â°16.080 Southwest winds

name: Razzano
desc:
Decollo grande con pendio leggero, facile per top, raggiungibile in 5 min su per scale.

Take off easy with very big slope, easy to top landing reachable by 5 min walk up the stairs.

name: Vene Rosse di San Giacomo
desc:
No problem, but only one pilot per time can take off due to site's dimension.
Reverse lanch is recommended.

name: Gallina
desc:
36.951538, 15.150677
It is easy to drive up to the takeoff. Even the Google car made it :https://www.google.hu/maps/@36.9517628,15.1510006,3a,75y,211.68h,84.99t/data=!3m6!1e1!3m4!1sOYQpNiitYg1e2p9LdA7bnA!2e0!7i13312!8i6656!6m1!1e1
The takeoff is in a garden of an empty house. Gate is open 0-24. The takoff is a bit rocky but easy to take off. Wind direction: S,SE,SEE. Strong wind is possible but behind your back there is a massive highland. So it is easy to find safe place to land.

name: Calascio Pinetina
desc:
Beautiful launch areas normally used in winter because it is located about 400 meters higher than the 'Panettone' In summer time is only for advanced pilot.

In the middle of the day the weather conditions are very strong

name: Pinetina
desc:
Beautiful launch areas normally used in winter because it is located about 400 meters higher than the 'Panettone' In summer time is only for advanced pilot.

In the middle of the day the weather conditions are very strong

name: Alpe Lusentino / Moncucco
desc:
Additional TO:
Moncucco: N46 05 23.9 E8 13 45.2; 1900m Föhn (N-wind)
ATTN: valley wind in spring/ summer can become pretty strong

name: Rocca Canavese
desc:
Takeoff is near a small church 'Madonna della Neve' on the top of nearby hill. Large enough to accomodate 3-4 simultaneous launches, smooth and suitable for beginners.

The takeoff can be easily reached by a 4x4 on a gravel road. Access by normal car may still be possible but the road to the top is rough and steep at some points.

There is a shuttle bus on almost every flyable day, which departs from bar at Via Levone 31, or at these coordinates: 45.309925, 7.583138

Also a nice 1hr hike (530m up) from the landing. Gravel road starts approx 500m east of the landing field from the main road. Follows the crest of the ridge all the way up. Do not fly in the presence of foen winds! Strong turbulence and wind gusts! Avoid flying also if the entry of such winds is forecasted on the same day. It is usually matter of few minutes to become dangerous and unflyable.

In summer months thunderstorms may build up very quickly, especially over Lanzo town some 10-15km away, keep your eye on development of cumulus clouds.

name: Meduno
desc:
Toplanding possible;
HG: ramp available

name: Isolabona
desc: https://goo.gl/maps/BUEncmecP512

desc: take off and landings for paramotor pilots...

name: Bassano -Camol
desc: newly improved launch; offers better possibilities on weak days to enter thermals than the lower launches

name: Castellucio -Trg Hill
desc: walk/ kite up the hill as far as necessary to fly off

name: Castelletto d'Erro
desc: null

desc: Easy south facing launch DO NOT FLY with north wind direction

name: Pavillion

desc: See Site Map and Pictures - good winds from NW to SW http://www.sarracino.it/

Molta cautela con vento da OVEST debole -  leggi il resto - http://vololiberobergamo.it/pagine/voli/pratino.html http://vololiberobergamo.it/pagine/menu/meteo.html

name: Nemina
desc: null

desc: decollo orientato a Sud-Est

name: Monte Antiogu Boi
desc: Takeoff is localized in a fire break line This takeoff is exposed to West/NorthWest wind ( Mistral). Notice that here the mistral wind is very often strong ! Since its  sun exposure the best time for takeoff is afternoon , or even better, in the evening during summer.

name: Decollo S. Michele
desc: The takeoff site is quite short; small stones make the run a bit slippery so it needs extra care while running. Bushes limit the lenght of the takeoff run, so even in case of mistakes the consequences are limited. Local club maintains wind sleeve and other wind indicators.

name: Monte S. Vittoria
desc: Very large takeoff area, top landing possible The best wind is West/SouthWest

name: Castello di Monteserico - Genzano di Lucania (PZ)
Monte Cucco - Decolo Nord
desc: Large grassy lane, flat on top - an easy takeoff. http://www.vololiberomontecucco.it/vlmc/index.php/it/meteo/sint-wind-pi-cucco

name: Monte Lignano
desc: Grass

name: Dromae and cima d oro
desc: Nstr

name: Varazze
desc: easy take off, next to the church

name: Carnale
desc: decollo

name: Scala
desc: Il decollo è molto panoramico, è adatto per tutti : Piloti e Allievi. L'esposizione e Sud-Est circa 800 metri slm coordinate 40°39'17''N 14°35'56''E Sud-Est

name: Maiori
desc: Il sito di volo più bello e suggestivo del Mondo. Dal centro di Maiori dista circa 6 Km, un Hike & Fly fantastico, con scorci mozzafiato tra cielo e mare, da qui si può ammirare tutta la Costa d'Amalfi e la Penisola Sorrentina un paesaggio unico al Mondo. Il decollo è adatto a tutti: Piloti e Allievi. Coordinata decollo circa 1000 slm Esposizione Sud-Ovest 40 ° 39'20''N 14 ° 40'13''E Sud-Ovest

name: Castellammare di Stabia - Monte Faito
desc:
Dal decollo è possibile osservare tutta la penisola Sorrentina da Capri, il Vesuvio e il sud della città di Napoli. Il decollo è esposto a Sud-Ovest e Nord-Est 900 metri slm E adatto a tutti: Piloti e Allievi. coordinare 40 ° 40'20''N 14 ° 27'39''E

Vom Startplatz aus ist es möglich, die gesamte sorrentinische Halbinsel von Capri, den Vesuv und den Süden der Stadt Neapel zu beobachten. Der Startplatz liegt exponiert zum Südwesten und Nordosten 900 Meter über dem Meeresspiegel und ist für alle geeignet: Freiflieger und Schüler. Sud-Ovest. Nord-Est

name: Pisciotta
desc: Decollo esposto a SW situato a 450 mt.slm: Si vola spesso con vento da O pieno nel pomeriggio. Possibilità di decollare anche con vento da S.

name: Monte Pennino
desc: Grassy slopes easy

name: Paesana Pian Croesio
desc: SE direction or N with moderate breeze

name: Principe
desc:
Ideal site for H&F or soaring in the afternoon valley breeze. Convenient for combining with a visit of Sacra S. Michele, which can be reached by a footpath from S.AMbrogio (600m vertical gain), via Ferrata, or simply by car.

The take-off itself, recently opened and cleaned, is large enough to host 2-3 gliders simultaneously. The take-off is a bit steep, but suitable for all levels of skill except only the very beginners. Minimum cloudbase required: 840m.

Flying with the valley breeze or calm conditions is ok.

Avoid flying the site when there is a strong wind from west. Being in the rotor, it may appear flyable, but being in the air will be unpleasant and dangerous.

name: Cherry peak
desc:
Ideal site for a small hike&fly!

Take-off is rather small, only 1 wind at a time. 

Be very careful wjen there is 0 wind, and avoid attempting the takeoff when the wind is from behind, even if very slightly. many people have been on the trees below already. This flying site is flyable when there is some valley breeze. It allows hours of soaring in the area of the takeoff. But flying XC from this site is very difficult. Use Monte Cucetto takeoff for XC instead.

Do not fly when strong westerly wind is present, or even only forecasted for the same day.

The valley breeze may become very strong on some days, especially in the summer. Best is to avoid flying in early afternoon.

name: Cugn
desc:
Direzione est (Verso Gravedona) Volabile con situazione da Sud,Sud-Ovest,Sud-Est,Est.
Attenzione alla Breva del lago di Como, che può raggiungere in estate anche i 40kmh già a partire dalle 12:00!

name: San Giuliano Terme
desc:
Grassy takeoff located at an altitude of 330 meters above sea level large enough to accommodate up to three paragliders. It does not present technical difficulties, so it is also particularly suitable for pilots with less experience.

The take-off area is facing westward and it is possible to fly with winds from SSW to WNW. Caution must be used with particularly angled winds from South or North.

Normally, there is a good front breeze coming from the sea as early as 11 am. The breezes may intensify in the middle hours of the day, and then it tends to gradually drop during the afternoon. We advise pilots to be careful of the wind intensity as the take-off is located inside a narrow valley. null

name: Refugio Auronzo / Tre Cie / Drei Zinnen
desc: several options around 'Rifugio Auronzo' depending on wind null

name: Skyline
desc: 1,450 ft asl; NE of Kingston; 15 min from town; steep and short launch; demanding for beginners but great for intermediate pilots; lee side thermal site sheltered from trade winds; launchable 9 out of 10; vertical: 750 ft sometimes strong easterly trade winds break through to Skyline site. We recommend not to fly when that is the case.

name: John Crow Hill
desc:
Drive-up on rough road;
Takeoff towards SW from shallow slope. Prevailing easterly trade winds over 10 mph are an impediment. They make launching impossible as it will be tail on launch. Rule of thumb: on a sunny day, thermals will block the trades up to 10 mph of strength.

name: Freehill
desc: from a saddle next to antenna mast in Freehill, St. Ann; accessible by car trade winds may be too strong and shred thermals

name: Pen Hill - Kirkvine
desc:
2,800 ft asl mountain top; 
NEW site - first flown July 2012 a bit sensitive to rotor due to easterly trade winds

name: Spur Tree South
desc:
grassy slope accessible from farm road; 
not maintained only launchable in light NW to SE conditions

name: Lovers Leap
desc: On top of a 1,600 ft coastal bluff facing SSE prevailing sea breeze is from SE, which does not always create sufficient lift

name: Cabbage Hill
desc: terraced and overgrown slope facing S, alternatively from cow patch below the antenna towers; site is not maintained often x-wind and too strong trade winds from E

name: King Talal Dam
desc:
Once you parked your car, continue by foot (around 100m.) on the dirt track.
you can take off from the track once you found the \'best wind oriented\' place on the hill Breeze may be strong in the afternoons in spring and summer.

name: Dana
desc:
very evident place, next to the gps point given ;)
lot of place and perfect slope, may be a bit short, or flat, if not windy. Landing at Dana village may be in the rotors, avoid above all flying down the -narrow- valley, it must be quite windy down there.

name: Little Petra / Beida - West 1700 (top)
desc:
Any place on the top of the hill, that is not to 'rocky', and y'ahla (let's go) make your own opinion, there is nothing special i noticed.
as alaways, breeze can get strong in the spring/summer afternoons, come early or try an evening soaring.

name: Mount Nebo
desc:
On the hill just south of the church of the real Mount Nebo.
There\'s a track leaving to road to the left just 100m after the church tourists parking lots. Walk that track and find any suitable place to take off. no particular hazard : basic thermals site

name: Djebel Rum
desc:
top of Jebel Rum, 800m high hike to get there. Ropes needeed, you will need to take a guide to go up there.
I heard of a NE take off place, but haven\'t been there. Breeze can quickly become strong and crazy during the hot seasons, this flight is rather to be done in very quiet condition, for the eyes pleasure, in a quiet air.
Desert weather may be stronger than you, so be careful.

name: Burdha Arch
desc:
Route best - Best to take a guide to the takeoff. Avoid going to the Arch and go around the back to above the arch. or try from previous explorers as follows - 

Short and sharp, above the famous burdah arch.
Pass the arch and continue up like 50meters (a short difficult \'climbing\' move : a 10m piece of rope may be helpful to climb first without the bag then bring the glider up with the rope)

name: Wadi Mujib - South face
desc:
Coming from north (amman), on your left just before starting the road down to the Wadi (200m before the viewpoint parking).
You can take off from a flat clean field.
When the breeze is there you should find good orientation here. none

name: Wadi Mujib - North face
desc:
Just West of the 'Trajan' hotel.
Wind may be a bit sideway (coming from your left) since valley breege is West Sideway wind.

name: Beida - South West
desc:
The cleanest take off in Jordan : a clean almost flat area with rocks and small bushes down.
Greatly placed in the thermal/breege activity.
In case of strong wind at the 'West take off', you may be better here since it is a bit lower. Strong breeze...

name: Beida - West 1400 (parking)
desc: Just next to the road that crosses Beida village ang goes East to the pass. Strong breeze, be careful if it get stronger during the day not to get caught in too strong wind.

name: Beida North-West
desc:
On a field, rather clean (april 2007).
A big rock separates the takeoff in two sectors, one rather West, the other more North-West.

name: Palaces road
desc: Just next to the road. Clean flatened place.

name: Disi sand dune
desc: obvious, as high as you wish to walk on the dune

name: Zai
desc:
Follow signs for 'Mountain Breeze Paintball' from Amman or Salt.
Road to take off is 500M North East of turn off for MB. Take 4WD track down north. Field is obvious on right.

name: Wadi bin hammad
desc:
large and flat place, no problems except the rocks laying on the ground.
Keep an eye on the electrical wires that run close to the take off !! As always, watch the conditions which can get hard in the country, except for that, nothing special.

name: Mukawir
desc: Several possible takeoffs near the track.  Very good and clean takeoff. No alwasy easy to understand the wind behavior.

name: Wadi Mujib - East face
desc: Easy takeoff. Carefull the east wind might get stronger at sunset.

name: Wadi Mujib West / Hidan
desc: The GPS is approximative : find the suitest launch place nearby and come back here to give the real point ;) Close enough. Just go west bit further to the edge of hill.

name: Zarqa Maain
desc: Flat top. Track below takeoff can cause problem for lazy takeoff technique. NW to N best. Can take a bit of NE

name: Gharqā
desc: Takeoff easy next to road in an area used for parking at times. Not too much vegetation to grab your canopy

name: Rally Track
desc:
Takeoff only with wind max 15 deg either side due turbulence from hills to north and south.
Small Takeoff Area has been cleared of rocks. Max Two gliders at a time better one at a time. Short takeoff so manage your glider well before committing West with touch of South West and touch of North West but not much

name: Nakijin
desc: A tight, grassy spot with room for one glider at a time. North facing (winter site). About 30 metres above the beach. Walk back up a paved road in 5 minutes to get back to the launch.

name: Kayo
desc: The takeoff is about 100 metres elevation over the shore.  It's out on a point that is best accessed by walking the last 5 minutes, although people do drive right to the takeoff (there is a very narrow spine  -  just over the width of a vehicle  -  on the way out to the point, where slides have occurred on both of the sides). There is room for one glider at a time to set up. (Although there is plenty of room behind.)

name: Ibaraki (Air Park COO)
desc:
Different TO/ LZ for HG's Wind/ weather:
- https://de.windfinder.com/forecast/ibaraki_air_park_coo
- Ishioka: https://www.jma.go.jp/bosai/#lang=en&pattern=forecast&area_type=class20s&area_code=0820500

name: Teniya
desc: The takeoff is on a bluff overlooking a long beach, at about 100 metres elevation.  It's accessible by any vehicle, although it's not so easy to find... You can get to it from the sugarcane fields above the village of Teniya. None except the obvious (typhoons).

name: Paraglider Park Aoki
desc: 2 TOs, accessible by car Aoki weather: https://www.jma.go.jp/bosai/#lang=en&pattern=forecast&area_type=class20s&area_code=2034900

name: Asagiri -DK Skygym
desc: Training hill (pyramid) allows training with all wind directions ;-)

name: Minakami ('Grand-Volee')
desc:
Very nicely maintained TO with minibus and railway to right to takeoff. You can also hike to the top in 45-60 mins . Very nice shrine just below takeoff and nice views of the valley.

TO only for southerly or SW/SE. Cannot fly in N/W/E conditions. Thunderstorms in summer. Slipping off TO when it's covered in snow in winter :-)

name: Parafield
desc: Parafield has 4 TO's, easily accessed on foot. All season can fly.

name: Hakuba -Happo One
desc:
Different TO's available: coordinates given for 'Gondola TO': just outside first section of gondola.
- HG-TO: by top of second section
- competition TO (PG) (> see pix)

name: Tsukuba -NiihariKomachi
desc: another take off (Wind:NE) : 36 10'23' (36.1730)N; 140 9'16' (140.154)E - Elevation : 352 m.(Height : 316 m, GR : 3.86)

name: Mt Itajiki Hangglider Area
desc: Three takeoff ramps for hang glider pilots only. Ramps all generally face S-SSW (named East, Main, West). wind: https://de.windfinder.com/forecast/mt_itajiki_hangglider_area

name: Misunomaru
desc: https://www.windfinder.com/forecast/misunomaru

name: Iwayasan Flight Area
desc: open field Wx fcst of nearby Fukuchiyama City: https://www.meteoblue.com/en/weather/week/fukuchiyama_japan_1864009

name: Asagiri Inogashira (Wingkiss)
desc: Accessible with a shuttle service. Easy launch.

name: Uono
desc: wide, nicely grooved; TOP-landable Best: mid-september thru November

name: Yatake
desc: large; parking just behind

name: Oogoshi (Sakaide)
desc:
Data in map is for EAST -TO/ LZ!
West TO: N34.36349 E133.89988,270m

name: Ohsayama Flight Area (Mt.Osa)
desc:
different TO's available for HG and PG.
PG: large for main wind direction.

name: Keihoku
desc:
Acces to TO only possible by contacting flight school (> private road/ locked gates/ dirt road, requires 4x4).
Parking space at club house.

name: Nanyo Skypark
desc:
- Mt.Jubuichi (500m above sea level.)
40m wide by 150m long
south-east to south-west wind is best.
- Mt.Takatsumuji (700m above sea level.)
westward 60m wide by 25m long.eastward 60m wide by 25m long.
Both site can drive right up to the takeoff. all season you can fly.

name: Kuratake
desc:
TO is a 5 minute walk from the road; faces south-east with wonderful views of the sea with numerous islands.  There is ample space and clearance for safe takeoffs. actually best in light 'lee condition'
- https://www.windfinder.com/forecast/kuratake

name: Kirikabu-yama
desc: There are several TO's at the slope edge of this flat-top mountain. Few that are not obvious standing on the mountain top.

name: Kannami (eX Paragliding)
desc: Approximately 300 meters above LZ; just off Izu Skyline High winds, but easily/ predictably forecasted well in advance - typical sea breeze flying...

name: Ojigatake/ Ojigadake
desc: space for 1 PG at a time

name: Iriki
desc: Straightforward, west-facing. Probably nothing too tricky.

name: Sky Shishiku
desc: artficial 'grass', right in front of gondola

name: Ikusaka
desc: Top landing possible

name: Mt. Katsuragi
desc:
Located on top of Mt. Katsuragi (alt. 950m).
There are two take offs, one is facing west (alt. 930m), the other is facing east (alt. 830m). In order to get to take offs, you have to ride Mt. Katsuragi Rope Way which costs 760JPY.

name: Daikanbo
desc:
Located in the immediate vicinity of the Daikanbo Lookout, one of the most famous tourist spots in the Mt. Aso area, itself a very well known destination in Japan.  Fly with a large peanut gallery of excited tourists! Wind: https://de.windfinder.com/forecast/daikanbo

Located at an altitude of 930m in topography with great relief, this is big air (at least for Kyushu).  With light winds it's easy to get dropped, whereas strong winds can be gusty and the lift extreme, making it very difficult to topland or get away from the mountain.

name: Zojiro
desc: Located at an elevation of 645m near the top of Mt. Zojiro in the Central Kyushu Mountains, a very high-relief region with excellent scenery and flying potential, Zojiro is one of Western Kyushu's hidden gems.  Access is easy via a 20 minute drive from the landing on a mostly paved road, and there is plenty of space to spread out at least a half-dozen gliders.  Top landings are a piece of cake. There are very few hazards here that are not obvious to most pilots.  Valley wind, rotors, venturis, etc. exist as you would expect for mountainous terrain.  Perhaps the greatest hazard is that it is difficult to visualize the wind patterns; if you venture out from the vicinity of the TO, a large area of sink may bring you down into a tight spot with few landing options before you know it.

name: imaihama flying school
desc:
Only one glider can spread each time.
Good wind direction is NE to S.

name: Takayama East
desc: 500m launch site. Able to launch in N ~ S winds.

name: Kanemi-dake
desc: a hang-glider type launch pad on the summit of mt. kanemi. a little tight but doable.  combination of small elevation difference and the fair distance to the landing make it, well again, a little tight but doable. the topography of long and low ridges stretching in the direction of the landing make the site very sensitive to changes in wind direction. strong winds come up quite suddenly, and if they are at an angle to the ridges, expect a rough ride.  on the other hand, due to the unusual (for south kyushu) north-westerly orientation of the site, it is occasionally the only flyable area on a given day in all of kyushu.

name: Aoshima
desc: Only 45m above sea level on the beautiful 'devil's washboard' coast.  soar the ridge for several kilometers to the south with the pacific ocean surf crashing down below.  show off in front of the crowds by buzzing the highway-side visitor center and slaloming palm trees along the coastal road.  must be experienced! if the wind gets just a little too strong, it becomes virtually impossible to land, with no escape!  better land in a hurry at the first sight of whitecaps on the ocean!  similarly, if the wind dies and you are 3km away on the other end of the ridge, you are going down, baby.  landing on the washboard rocks below means broken legs unless one is very skillful. both wind phenomena do happen regularly and unpredictably!  even though (in fact, because) the scale is small, this is an area for skillful flyers only!

name: Okamidake (Ogami)
desc: 640m ASL, wide enough for two paragliders to be laid out side-to-side easily. Artificial traction surface with grass growing through it â€“ very easy launch, plenty of running room, no bushes, entanglements, etc. Plenty of wind indicators. Top landing possible. No specific weather hazards.

name: Soratopia (aka Ashio / Ashio-san)
desc:
Different TO's available for allmost all wind directions (except W).
Shown on map: main TO on top of ridge.
South TO: N36 16 06.1 E140 09 01.4; 445m Wind/ weather:
- https://de.windfinder.com/forecast/ibaraki_air_park_coo
Ishioka: https://www.jma.go.jp/bosai/#lang=en&pattern=forecast&area_type=class20s&area_code=0820500

name: Paratopia (Goryu)
desc: Top of the telecabins 'Hakuba Goryu Escal Plaza'.

name: Komenoyama
desc: Met fsct/ wind: https://de.windfinder.com/forecast/fukuoka

name: JMB Tateyama
desc:
wind: https://de.windfinder.com/windstatistics/jmb_tateyama
10-day fcst: https://weather.com/weather/tenday/l/Tateyama+Japan+JAXX1632

name: Hiyama
desc: Several takeoffs located on the mountain (called Hi-yama) immediately next to the beach.  Max elevation difference is about 200m. wx fcst (nearby) https://de.windfinder.com/forecast/nishinoura

name: Ikedayama (Mt.Ikeda)
desc: separate TO's for HG and PG

name: Tottori -Sakyu (Sanddunes)
desc: the Japanese version of 'Dune du Pyla' - not as large, but you can still 'play' as long as you like...

name: Kinokawa Flight Park
desc: large, but rather flat!

desc: null

desc: null

desc: null

desc: null

name: Kamui
desc: easy https://www.sunny-spot.net/sis/sky/index.html?area=1&location_id=0055

name: Pippu
desc: http://www.sunny-spot.net/sis/sky/index.html?area=1&location_id=0020

name: Akaigawa
desc: null

name: Minou-Kankake  (Mino-Kankake)
desc: At the top of the ridge, very easy.  Top-landings are possible. In high pressure conditions, the right (north) wind comes in often, especially but not limited to the winter season.  When it is too strong, try the nearby Kirikabu site (and vice versa).

name: Kagami-yama
desc: Huge, flat, and well-groomed.  Top-landings are super easy. Sea breeze conditions off the Pacific Ocean.  Forecast wind should be east to south; sometimes local winds turn out even if somewhat out of this range.

name: Dodaira S
desc: SSE

name: nanamagari skypark
desc: https://goo.gl/maps/Hhs1m6sxeNuWRokR8 South to Northeast wind

name: kawane skypark
desc: https://goo.gl/maps/b7413kgeXA2Yav5U9

name: Glideryama
desc: small, steep; 1 glider at a time

name: Furano
desc: null

name: Kabuto-Iwa
desc: grassy meadow; top-landing possible often flyable in the morning, when nearby Daikanbo is not yet working.

name: Sky park Utsunomiya
desc: null

name: Ohira Sky Club
desc: null

name: Tsugaike
desc: null null

name: Katelembo
desc: Machakos is what the local pilots call this place--which is misleading since the site is nowhere near the larger range behind Machakos. A more appropriate name is Katalembo, or Mua Hills.  In any case, launch consists of a small grassy area in the midst of a banana plantation.  There is a large tree to the immediate left of take-off.  The grassy area is maintained by the local farmer (his name sounded like, Pirsch). As of 2014 he asks 500 KSH for its use and to guard you car.  In any case, he does maintain a lovely manicured patch of grass for launching on (very nice!).

name: Kibini Hill
desc: Large take off area at the top of Kibini hill.  The hill is conical shaped with flatland all around.  Plenty of choice and only a few trees! Very strong conditions develop quickly! Thermals will develop from about 0800 hrs!

name: Kijabe
desc: Grassy, steap and can take off in all direction apart from north-east. Thunderstorms with all their inherent dangers can develop incredibly quickly in this part of the world.  Be very conscious of possible over-development!

name: Kerio Valley
desc: Kerio Valley or better - up in the Highlands of Kenya - here in this area you'll find many places to start - also ideal for beginners. The west side of Kerio Valley is the best part to fly (90% of the wind will come from east). Down to the bottom of the valley is a hight difference from about 1200 m. The ideal starting place is near the Hotel Kerio View! http://www.accuweather.com/world-forecast.asp?partner=accuweather&traveler=0&locCode=AFR|KE|KE007|ELDORET&metric=1

name: Shimba Hills
desc: Ridge soaring on a 100m high ridge, wind off the sea. Best conditions in September-November. Strong trade winds and overdevelopment.

name: Masue Hill
desc: The take off is easy to find. Follow the road and approx. 200m before you reach the antenna you find the launch site left hand of the road.

name: Ilbisil
desc: Huge grassy ridge with takeoff possibilities everywhere The usual in this part of the world: possible strong winds, and thunderstorms that may develop very rapidly.

name: Chon-Tash
desc:
Height 1500 meters
Elevation above the valley 200 meters

Coordinates: UTM 43T 0467564, 4729245
 

The place is a cradle of the Kyrgyzstan Paragliding. Placed under the Tysacha takeoff. Very easy accessible by any car (almost). Good for th North and North-West winds.

With good weather you can easily fly up to the Tysyacha.And you can start a good flight from there if succeeded to climb up..

name: Otres hill
desc: Flat very easy

name: Bokor
desc: Takeoff is located on a mountain near the Old Casino

name: Mt. Jungkwang
desc:
Really narrow but nice.  Carpeted with nothing to snag your canopy.

Technical with windy conditions because of the size.

Really difficult trail. Need a 4x4 to get to the top.  Don't attempt the hike. The local schools organize shuttles. May seems to be the month with highest winds.

name: Gan Wahl Jae
desc: 980 Meters

name: Am Dahl San
desc: Low for Korea 196m

name: Day Am San
desc: All seasons

name: Yumyungsan
desc:
The site features three launch areas that cater for slightly different wind directions. All launch sites are netted over so snagging is rare.
The two most popular launch sites are free from obstructions and have gentle grassy slopes. The third is steeper and has trees either side as you take off.

name: Danyang
desc: There are at least four takeoffs, each maintained by one of the tandem operators. I asked them nicely if it is okay for me to use their space. Never had an issue. Ideal is a north-westerly wind direction. But the area is also shielded a bit from other directions.

name: Mt BangJang
desc:
name : Mt Bang-Jang
alti : 646m(real 540m) no

name: Gom Doli
desc: Open Area cut into the trees with matting on the ground for reduced plant growth. Clear knob with steep drop away. South Launch therefore south wind or nil is best. Glide out to LZ is easy but you do need to head south to reach in a no lift day.

name: KoJyae BongSan
desc:
Relatively short but well maintained for both Hanggliders and Paragliders
Easy access by 3 roads. Parking relatively welcoming West winds are tricky since takeoff is on leeside or ridge.

name: Choburi
desc: Great launch area with several trucks that go up several times a day.  Practive take offs and landings for ~$27 a day (for the truck ride) or walk for free.

name: Geoje-si
desc: Open wide square shaped grass area cut out.  Area is slope at an angle that your glider slide down a little when you lay it out.  Clear maintained by club members.  Drive up cement/gravel road.  Be aware of hike ring and bikers using same road. Launch is not at top of ridge.  Rotor over top can be mistaken for updraft into launch.  Check conditions on peak by walking or driving the 100m greater altitude to assure direction is real.

name: Jil Lae
desc:
ì‚°183 Sinan-ri, Jillye-myeon
Gimhae, Gyeongsangnam-do
35.219180, 128.744177

Open wide square shaped grass area cut out. Area is slope at an angle that your glider slide down a little when you lay it out. Drive up cement/gravel road. Be aware of hike ring and bikers using same road.
Audience can be impressive on weekends.

name: SamcheonPo
desc:

Sacheon, Gyeongsangnam-do, CorÃ©e du Sud

Short maintained track with steep slope, require appropriate wind and sprint for safe takeoff

Gentle slope, beware of treeline while taking off

name: Haman
desc:
35.291459, 128.456634

road up to the summit, 50m walk from parking
Beware that slope is steep and track short.
Beware of huge powerlines on the eastern slope. Huge 20kV powerlines to stay away from

name: Haman 2
desc:
Take off :
35.291459, 128.456634 
road up to the summit, 50m walk from parking 
Beware that slope is steep and track short. 
Beware of huge powerlines on the eastern slope. Huge 20kV powerlines to stay away from

name: Songdo
desc:
Take off Coordinates:
35.0761781,129.0094605,896
Parking Lot is 10min hike away. Avoid too strong winds as would be pushed back to leeside with no landing option

name: Gubongdo Island
desc: Prepared surface with W to N winds required.  Large power lines on south side. West to north winds required.  Low tide a bonus.

name: Gangdong-myeon
desc: Big grassy field. Not too steep.

name: Yangbangsan Observatory
desc: Several takeoff directions. Very short / cliff-like on the eastern side.

name: Pyeongtaek-si
desc: Boat towing only, kite surfing office is 50m away light winds

name: Geum Oreum
desc: Just south from the antennas. Large enough to fit >3 wings simultaneously. Summer is wet, the best flying is in spring and autumn. The site is easily soarable.

name: Ush Konyr
desc: 1969m ASL

name: Taldy
desc: Semey

name: Hammana
desc:
Quite good and easy takeoff.
Top landing possible, but be careful when conditions become strong! Conditions can get quite strong quite quickly : don't wait too much before going to landing unless you can find some thermals turbulences at landing.

name: The Cedars - Top takeoff
desc: this is the top take-off, at around 2900m, this is the highest take-off in the middle east. Take off is very easy on a nice slope. Eatern winds can create a rotor and give a false head wind at the take-off. If you are not familiar with the site dynamics, contact the locals.

name: The Cedars - Bekaa side
desc: A little rocky take-off under the main road. An alternative take-off is above the road used in southern winds. The site is oriented inwards toward the Bekaa and has some very strong thermals espacially during the day. The site is only is usually used in the morning and the evening only.

name: The Cedars - Intermediate takeoff
desc:
Maybe the nicest site in lebanon....
Shuttle is possible : meeting point at the snack.
The meeting point for paragliders is a snack close to the road to the landing.

name: Ghosta
desc: small take off, experienced pilots only non flyable by north wind

name: Miziara
desc:
a clean and easy place, just between the two electric poles.
Just next to the plane-house, very strange boeing shapped building, worth a look !

name: Faraya - Wardeh
desc: About 100 meters down the chair-lift arrival station, on the ski slope that is on your left when you are sitting on the chair-lift going up.

name: Faraya - Mzar
desc:
down the chairlift station at the top of the Mzar mountain.
A very comfortable place, a bit rocky, but with no obstacles and friendly progressive slope.

name: Jbeil
desc: short

name: Dedeh
desc: not so large but ok with a little wind

name: The Cedars - Soaring ridge
desc: Accessible from the main road (Behind the Polaris building).

name: Annaya
desc: quite short, but breeze helps.

name: Knuckles
desc:
Take off= 7 22'47.65' N and 80 46'07.17 E

Elevation = 3487 feet Basically no weather hazards, can fly with superb weather from January to August.

name: James Taylor's Seat
desc: Small takeoff that really only has room for one wing at a time. Caution trees on both sides of takeoff and a metal fence at the bottom of the takeoff. But overall quite easy.

name: Kandy /Delthota
desc: very easy to takeoff

name: Valkininkai
desc:
Large airfield. Works under all wind directions. Parking on the side of the airfield where you see other cars parked and where winch operator instructs.
Site is mainly operated by Arcus flying school (www.paragliding.lt) with stationary winches. Expect tow heights up to 300m in nil winds and over 500m in stronger winds.

Pilots are expected to have tow release device. Site is used if wind is up to 6m/s.

name: Klabiniai
desc: There are two country roads used for towing under different wind directions. Site is usable under all wind directions. Pilots are expected to have tow release device. Tow operators can be contacted at www.skraidom.lt Local pilots usually fly with winds up to 6m/s.

name: Birstonas
desc:
There is a guy who tows with winch, here is a phone: +37061032016. Site works for all wind directions. Typical tow is 500m for nil wind and up to 1000m in stronger wind.

If you see paragliders in the air you can reach pilots and winch operator on 445.100Mhz frequency. No weather hazards in that area. Local pilots usually fly if the wind is up to 6 m/s.

name: Netoniai
desc:
just a simple hill, surrounded by some trees and smaller buildings.  One power line goes nearby. 

taking off just walk down from hill and start soaring. Trees and smaller buildings, 5 kW power line, crowd.

name: Leonpolis
desc: Small grass field between country road and the lake. Ideal for SW wind. Light W or S - ok. Winch towing to about 500-600m.

name: Gringlay
desc:
49Â° 54.947'N
6Â° 5.510'E
Oriented W/SW. 
Elevation 440m Defense to land right side of the bridge 
Prohibition to land at the point of takeoff! Landing regular with the Camp-site â€œUm Grittâ€. 
Emergency landing with the raised meadow, vis-a-vis the Hotel 'Vieux Moulin'

name: Michelau
desc: E-NE https://holfuy.com/de/weather/757

name: Jurkalne
desc: Same as Landing. Depends on wind speed. If slower wind - takeoff is from top. If wind is strong then takeoff is from bottom/beach. Relative height is around 10-12m

name: Skriveri
desc: Any place at the top of the hill or from the slope. Rotors when wind is coming from sides. Fly only when the wind is near perpendicular to the slope.

name: Rumbula
desc: Old airfield. Flatland

name: Krustpils air field
desc:
2 km long air field slope in good condition. Air field is old and not being used by airplanes.
Towing launch only.
Site is flyable up to 3 km high.

name: Agadir - Kasbah
desc:
alti: around 600m.
just at the entry's casbah. Short landing. Slope hard. be carreful with strong west wind becuse of houses and industrial port.

name: Nid d'Aigle Auberge
desc: alti: 250m. Takeoff is a concrete surface Warning with south and north wind!!!

name: Idikel (Idikl/ Tafraout)
desc:
From the Road Agadir to Tafraout before crossing the gap at Fifilou 
(here good place to check the wind condition and alternative launch for experts) 
turn left on the good dirt road and follow for about 2 kms 
(passing remainders of a mining camp) until reaching a small saddle: 

here the road turns left and follows a mountain flank. At the turn you find a flat surface overlooking parts of the valley to the southwest. You walk horizontally 200 mts towards the edge and find several cleaned, small take off fields.

It is usually an afternoon flying (soaring with the valley winds from the west and thermals never fly with north or east (Chergui), wait until thermal gusts stop blowing as it is a rocky area.
several incidents in the past years.
No infrastructure!

name: Aglou beach
desc:
Alti: 10-100m, depending from where you launch...
The given GPS-position is just one of many possibilities to TO and land.

name: Aguergour
desc:
alti: around 1300m.
Little stones. Big crest.
often strong winds In summer be careful of dust-devils.

name: Ait-ourir
desc:
very long crest. Wherever you want. stony ground.

you need to find a way to hike up. there's a hiking trail that starts at geo:31.53560,-7.69303, far up north on the crest, goes around it on the northern side and from NW it was hikeable all the way to top, so actually 'behind' the crest. maybe there's a way on the south ridge as well.. might be rotor on top. i gave up attempting to TO from the highest point (where the 3 'arms' of the ridge meet) and settled to a tiny gap between the trees in the north. maybe walking some kilometers along the crest towards south would have done it as well.

name: Legzira (the hill)
desc:
West Direction  easyly but wind after 3 PM 
Thermal and dynamic fly.
When wind is northerly, there is the possibility to soar right over the arch... As usually in thermal-dynamic condition near the water, don't pass over the Crest.

Toplanding is hazardous because of lots of cactuses ! ;-))

name: Merzouga Dunes
desc:
EVERYWHERE you want !!!! Be carafull with DUST Devils !

Between Mars to Spetember you can met some Thermals Tempests Everywhere !

name: Nigel's Place
desc: large graveled area on main ridge left at top of road. None

name: Sidi Ifni
desc: High take off with smooth soaring in the coastal air of the morning or evening winds but gently thermic in the middle of the day.

name: Tiz'n Test
desc:
small place under the hotel 'Bellevue' at Tiz'n Test.
Other TO: right on the pass, take the dirt road leading to the transmitter station. TO is on the rocky slopes just before you reach the transmitters (N30.86831 W8.37950, 2430m). often (too) windy

name: Tifnit
desc: many places to lay out

name: Touflith / Ait Barka
desc: Walk west a few hundred meters from Antennaes site.  Several slopes with varying orientations.

name: Mzouda
Kerdous
desc: The site has a large flat takeoff area (see photos). As there is very little slope it can be difficult to launch in weak wind conditions. Add TO: further up the ridge The conditions can change quite quickly at times in the mountain and one has to be careful to monitor what is going on while you are in the air.

name: Tirhmi
desc:
The takeoff is on the mountain ridge North of Tirhmi fairly close to a mast which is visible from the town.

There are a few takeoff options, but the main one is about 100m East of the junction in the track once it reaches the top of the ridge where there is a small village.(see photos) When the thermals start to work, wind direction can change quickly on the ridge and one needs to be careful to watch this when launching.

name: Taghazout
desc:
Take the earthroad to camping 'Terre D'Ocean'
in Taghazout ( 25km north of Agadir )        
N30.56291     W9.74071

The takeoff is easy, but not realy big
the seabreeze can be strong When there are a lot of white caps on the waves, then the wind is too strong.
(easy to see from takeoff )

name: MTERBA
desc:
Technical takeoff.
GPS (33Â°48'02.50')N; (4Â°44'31.00')W.
Elevation :1000m

desc:
NOT FOR BEGINNERS

name: Roghi
desc:
There are 3 take-offs near village Roghi. 
E-NE takeoff
N Takeoff
NW-W takeoff

Very nice place for soaring and XC above flatland.

name: brajici
desc: We have made take off better and bigger so its good for say maximum 2 pilots on take off at any one time.. landing can be very difficult during july and august and no landing agreements exist as yet during the summer season.landing area is too crowded..ok for good pilots. good for acro...very lttle advice or accurate information is available from the few local pilots, at time of writing oct 2012 we are still waiting for official conformation from ministry of civil aviation that airspace has been changed to class G.This would finally give us a legal standing to fly. No one has authority on this site, beware airspace restrictions above take off and also above the beach as you will enter a TMA at 500m. no legal agreement exists for either the take off or the landing areas on the beach.Very few local or visting pilots will be aware of exactly where or what the airspace restrictions are, some may not even have a basic qualification. occassional summer Cu NIM ACTIVITY...also strong  katabatic wing called Bora..it is so strong that no one would think of flying!

name: Buljarica
desc: Small rocky takeoff suitable for all levels of pilots in good conditions. matts are are a good idea to protect the lines on take off. Good for flyig south towards Bar. Beware of strong sea breezes...you will not feel them on take off! look at the sea..if there are white caps to the waves, do not fly.

name: Vrsuta
desc: Massive grassy mountain top with light wind take off...conical top means light winds only..if wind is from the back..north... dont fly.. do not fly in any kind of strong wind

name: Mojkovac
desc: Lush grassy meadow.

name: Dizdarica

No special warnings.
South wind components are best for flying hire.

Wide meadow overlooking Bosaca village.

name: Balj
desc:
Take off is located directly below the repeater in 1543m.
area for take off  is 50X50 m.,  grassy areas with rocky areas

name: Visitor
desc: Take of is over 1800 meters (Hb) , on fields with low grow ,launching with   N, NW,NE wind! after midday is very possible strong winds a cross valley and lake , directions is S , SW

desc: Take off here

name: Sjenice

name: Dečić
